tO8VNXlNtICrNEzf2CgjzQ.text: I have passed Baku many times, wondering what it's like.  A client encouraged me to try it, so we did.  The food was delicious.  Everything we ordered was perfectly done and beautifully presented.  We had the soft shell crab salad, the sea bass skewers, the seared blue fin tuna, the wagyutataki roll, the sea bass entree and another skewer that I can't remember. We also had red and white wine.  The waiter was very nice and helpful.  The wine pours were average and the selection good.  The reason I gave it four stars and not five, is because it's confusing to order.  They have a lot of small plates and honestly, they are just as filling as the entrees, which are small. They are priced similarly, so we ended up over-ordering which was yummy but ran up the bill significantly. The freshness and uniqueness of the menu is almost worth the price. Yes, I said almost, which means I will be back but not next week. The atmosphere, though a little "cold" is calming like a spa. I do recommend this place.  It will not disappoint a good Charlotte foodie or a visitor to the area. Compliments to the chef.

G15uMhSzvzeofepqkcTE5g.text: I love Baku - Brussels sprouts, skewers, sushi - its all been delicious. It's dark inside so be prepared for that, but service is strong and food/drinks are great. Great addition to the neighborhood.

uUREFJgDW5f44-So59n4OQ.text: Wonderful as always. Each dish is stunning and delicious.  Our server Chris Smith was perfection, no rush, no annoyance he left us take our time and enjoy a lovely evening. Thank you, Chris. See you soon.

PxIV1AOKQvVJiGljrB2EJg.text: I decided to write a review since they seem to be so mixed on here- and I almost didn't want to come thinking I would be disappointed. We started out at the upstairs bar with a couple Nigori Blue Martinis- Belvedere unfiltered vodka dirty martinis, so good we never even switched to wine during the meal, we just kept these comin'. Only $11- good deal. We sat downstairs at a booth, our server was awesome, all the staff seemed very polite.   Now- the food. We ordered a variety and shared everything. Favorite thing hands down was the tuna tartare with what I think were taro root chips- this stuff was heaven in your mouth. Other plates that really stood out were the salmon belly nigiri, rock shrimp tempura, and the yellowtail roll with serrano peppers, cucumber and avocado. Crispy calmari with serrano peppers was good too. We also tried the wagyu beef tataki, gokujo tuna roll, lobster & avocado roll, and of course we had to get the giant Madagascar prawn. Everything was delicious!! All of the presentation was beautiful and the plates rolled out a few at a time so we had a chance to really enjoy them. Decor is really cool, great vibe and relaxing & inviting atmosphere. Extensive sake list, will have to explore more next time. It was a great dining experience- I can't wait to try their brunch. Will definitely be back again!

wgVA_M0EBgQ6Ffc16I51wA.text: I don't get why so many people are raging  about this place. Here's my tale of disappointment:  Went here last night since everyone that I knew of was telling me that I gotta try it and that my fellow yelpers said some of the reviews here are just flat out lies. So I came here to accomplish both goals of getting the experience first-hand and write a honest review.   So, back to the story, I came in (had a appointment at 10pm) and I immediately notice the type of people that goes here. Let me tell you, I'm from a pretty well-off family, so I know the difference between wealthy people and snobby ones that doesn't have the money but just act like they do. And I noticed there were ton of those snob. Which is strike one on my list.   Later on at 10:10 pm I was asked to be seated in the back of the room which I'm not fond of since I prefer seating in single seat but oh well. The waiter then gave me a tour through the menu, however, he only went over wines and sake, saying how great their drinks are. I had to ask him about foods, and he wasn't really sure about the sushi when I asked him questions on how fresh it is. Minus another point.  After ordering, the waiter brought out my wine and assuming that I paid nearly $50 that I would get a pretty decent wine (and the waiter even recommended it) I was extremely dissatisfied. I've travel to France and know what good wines are, and let me tell you, the one that Baku serves you are cheap quality wines for extremely ripoff price. You can buy it for 1/3 of the cost!  Now, onto the foods.  Disappointing also... The presentation look good but the taste and quality is a c- on my book. The steak was bleh since it wasn't flavorful (even though they said they are well known with using organic charcoals to make their grill foods delicious).  The duck meats was still kind of raw (goodness gracious) and the plum didn't suit with the duck meat. Their flavors were too different to be combined which made the dish taste unsettling.  Sushi.... Just flat out no. Sushi didn't taste fresh and way too watery. And the sauce that they used did not compliment the sushi, rather it hinders it by creating sour taste.   I don't mind price when it comes to food that are worth it. But when I receive foods that are poorly made, then my friend, I'm quite pissed off. If you want to go here and show off that you have money and claim that it's delicious then go right on ahead. But if you're like me, who actually prefer True culinary skills then this place isn't worth for you to come.   Well, that is the end of my extremely long story of woe. xox

YKqcb6w3u5w7IkQKgnTHig.text: I loved everything about this place. The food, decor and service were all fabulous. The food is designed for sharing. We started with two small plates: pork dumplings and the glazed chicken wings. They were both excellent. I really enjoyed the fresh lime and coarse salt that was served with the wings. It made the dish very flavorful. We also ordered the salmon and the chef's selection sashimi. The flavor and texture of the salmon was wonderful. It may have been the best salmon I've ever had. The sashimi was also good.  It was cut a little thick for my personal taste, but it was fresh and enjoyable.   The atmosphere is cute (trendy and welcoming). The service was excellent! Our waitress was knowledgeable and made great wine recommendations. Two thumbs up. I'll definitely be back!!

4kX3H98Jp0YuEgvhe6ZVKQ.text: A second review for one place? Still amazing. They've recently opened for brunch, and I absolutely had to stop in and try what they had working up. Here's my thoughts!  "Viking-style Brunch"   Fruit box - a variety of seasonal fruits served on bed of ice. Great to nibble on while waiting on my other guests to arrive. Enjoyed very fresh squeezed orange juice.   Liege Waffles - absolutely amazing. Lightly crisped waffles served with this great spread selection. Chocolate ginger and white chocolate mousse. We mixed them together. Incredible.   Sous Vide Eggs - sweet potato hash compliments the duck pastrami and egg that's cooked to a nice creamy perfection. All of this is drizzled with a yuzu hollandaise.. Making a very eclectic spin on the traditional brunch eggs Benedict.   There is a sushi cart offered with a widespread variety of rolls, sashimi and nigiris. We nibbled lightly on this .. Wanting to fill up on the brunchy goodness.   You're then offered a salad for the table... And we each got to select an entree. I chose the spicy filet... Always a favorite. My guests chose the jiodori chicken and the salmon teriyaki. We also devoured their wild mushroom kamamashi pot. Great warm ending to the meal. Especially for a rainy brunch Sunday.   I definitely recommend pairing your brunch with bubbles. We paired our waffles and eggs with the Moet Rose, but they offer a great list of bubbles and cocktails to start your Sunday off right.   Overall, Baku impresses again. For $36 a guest...to eat such an impressive array... Definitely a go-to brunch spot for something delicious that's a fresh change of pace.

2ALHMFRnqI9LpTs-2r4avw.text: I have such a hard time paying a hefty price for Asian food...I don't care how it's packaged...even if it's in a kettle hot pot. That said, however, this is a great new addition to SouthPark. Solid 3 stars and A-OK in my book.  Old world Asia meets modern New South. It's well polished and upscale sporting modern decor and loud "clubby" music while the menu boasts of old Asian traditions...didn't quite feel congruent, but I guess it works. In any case, the food was very good and very pricey. If you really want to impress someone or a client, this place is surely on par. Order many rounds of small plates and 3 or 4 will make any diner happy and leave with a full Buddha belly.  Valet and servers are friendly and eager to serve. Valet is in the front and regular parking is in the back or the parking garage/deck at the building next door.  Like I mentioned, great new restaurant, but not one that I'll become a regular. With those prices and atmosphere, I really have to be dolled up and have money to burn.

xzqE4tRu_AGU82pven_V5A.text: I wish I could remember my bartenders name. He was absolutely on point . Upstairs bar. Feeling a little home sick , missing the southwest spice. He made me feel right at home with a Serrano pepper mottled in my vodka grapefruit juice. The staff went out of there way to make us feel welcome. They made us some specialty rolls that were not on the menu and were on top of every need or want. These guys are truly a class act!!!! Definitely go out of your way to visit this place!!! Amazing ambiance!!!!!!

ZK3PJuLpLvf7VIAv-3bajA.text: I'm so glad I'm not the only one who isn't completely wowed by Baku! Phew.  The fella and I visited on a Wednesday night after making Open Table reservations, and we parked in the back to avoid the valet.  Upon entering, literally seven Baku staff members were lined up to the right of the door to... welcome us?  Bizarre.  We headed upstairs to have a drink since the downstairs bar was already a little crowded.  Our bartender was nice, but fully admitted she was having an off night after making the wrong drink then spilling the right drink.  Oy.  The decor is really cool - dark walls, orange fans on the ceiling, painted eyes on the wall staring at you - the staff are all very chic and sleek.  It definitely has a clubby vibe.  Onto the food!  After our drink, we were seated upstairs. Our waiter was awesome - he was so gracious and helpful and didn't even make fun of me when I had to ask for a fork (chopsticks aren't my forte).  The fella and I got a bottle of wine and ordered three of the small plates/appetizers so that we could try a little bit of everything.    * The pork belly skewers were good, but there wasn't a ton of flavor, and they were TINY.  We got two skewers with two tiny pieces on each. * The rock shrimp tempura tasted very fresh and light, and since there were six pieces, I got to take a few more bites than of the pork belly. * Lastly, we ordered the beef and asparagus skewers, which were good, but nothing to write home about.  There were three tiny pieces of beef and one piece of asparagus.  Two drinks at the bar cost $11 and $12 + tip.  Dinner was a $50 bottle of wine and those three small plates cost more than $60... then we added tip.  The moral of the story is that Baku thinks A LOT of their tiny portions, and I had to eat a real dinner when I got home.  Cool, hip ambiance and excellent service, but I just can't justify the price for what you get.

NYHjtJXGMGLbr23udo7Tyw.text: BF & I dined here this past Saturday. We got here a little before 630 & apparently the entire restaurant was booked with reservations, with the exception of the bar & the patio. It was pretty nice outside, so we decided to sit out on the patio. Our server was extremely knowledgeable. They have an extensive list of sake, & I'm not a sake expert but I decided you can't go wrong with the flavored ones. I got the fuji apple sake & my BF opted for the lychee sake.. both were great but the fuji apple was my favorite!  They have a few vegetarian items on the menu. The ones I remember are coal roasted shishito peppers, a couple of mushroom maki rolls, some type of sweet & sour tofu skewer, & wild mushroom kamameshi pot. I decided to get the peppers & was almost going to choose one of the sushi rolls, but I decided to try the kamameshi pot instead. The peppers do come with bonito flakes sprinkled on top, so we got them in a separate little bowl. My BF got the tempura tiger prawns, beef & asparagus skewers, & soft shell crab maki roll.  The shishito peppers came out first. They were tasty & not really spicy. They came with a little dipping sauce made of soy sauce & chili flakes. $7 was a little steep for a plate of peppers but I enjoyed them & would get them again.  The tempura tiger prawns came out next.. $12 for 5 pieces of fried shrimp.. what?? I kind of laughed when the prawns came out because at that price we were expecting at least ONE more to make it an even $2 per prawn. I did not eat them & while my BF seemed to like the prawns, he said they weren't really anything special.  Next up was the wild mushroom kamameshi pot. It came to the table unstirred, but I was unable to get a picture of it at the time because our server stirred it while explaining the dish. I enjoyed the flavors but again felt it was overpriced at $17 for some rice, mushrooms, & a few vegetables. The nice touch was that the rice on the bottom was a little crispy from the hot pot.. love it!  My BF got his beef & asparagus skewers (I think it came with 2) & soft shell crab roll. The skewers looked much better in person than that shitty picture I posted (blame the BF for that!) I think he liked the skewers & the roll was comparable to Cowfish prices but definitely not in size & taste.. Cowfish wins that hands down! I don't remember the exact prices of these 2 dishes individually, but together they must have been around $25 based on our bill.  Overall, the service was great, sake was awesome, & the food, while good, was definitely overpriced. We weren't particularly blown away by any of the dishes which is kinda disappointing for a meal close to $100 (including the tip). We will probably be back because my BF wants to try the duck & a couple of other grilled meat dishes, but Baku will likely not be in our regular rotation.

nYO91M6DzB24W0pASJ6yPg.text: This place is a very trendy upscale Japanese restaurant. I did not realize that at first and showed up in flip flops and jeans. I definitely felt out of place.   It is very pricey but I really enjoyed the tuna maki roll, eggplant pot stickers and hot tea that I ordered.  The reason I am giving this 3 stars is because of he prices and atmosphere. The sushi was great but not anything special, for the prices they are charging, it better be the best sushi ever.   The atmosphere was a little too pretentious for me, they had club music playing and it really seemed like a place that people went to just to look cool.  Overall, good food but the atmosphere was not at all what I wanted.

-aAie-WUQbWn3G_sdYbByA.text: As good as it gets for Japanese in Charlotte!   Went here on a whim with a friend and it didn't disappoint. The rolls were very well made and the presentation was excellent. The Alaskan crab roll was one of my favorites. The food is mostly tapas style meant to share... and most of the small plate portions are a little small.   Everything grilled is cooked on a Japanese grill with coals imported from Japan which gives it a very unique flavor. Their black cod was excellent... I'm gonna say it reminded me of Nobu's... though the execution was a little off. All their beef is prime, we also had the Waygu NY strip and it was delicious.   Cocktails were ok, nothing out of this world and the service was decent. Overall I think they did a good job, albeit the NY city prices... this is a place good for an expense account.

XCeT51S3X-3cCJUrZ-04GA.text: Went for restaurant week, was not impressed.   Salad was spring mix with Asian dressing, my fav dish, sadly. Dumplings were below par, filet was semi cold. My friends got the sea food choices (I'm allergic) and weren't impressed either. The staff was nice, but they forgot our entrees twice :(    I'm thinking they were having an off day, oh well. Won't be returning.

x1hXEpXecvfKhfthvJgG9A.text: It started great. They called me back to confirm my reservations. From there it was down hill. Reservation were for 7:30pm. The hostess said I cannot go upstairs to wait by the bar because it's full. I went anyway. There was plenty of room. I was not seated until 8pm!! What did I make reservations for? It took an hour and a half to get some food. Food came wrong. I just cancelled the rest of the little order I've placed. It wasn't busy! When I asked to complain the manager had excuses. Before he even came to the table he was ready with: "sorry you waited for the sushi". Argued that the bar was busy when I came. (Hello, I was there...). Waitress and her manager just said: yes we know... about the lack of service. Horrific service. Hard to believe with this type of service, they are still in business. Or maybe no one cares. If I was management and found out about that, I would not be happy! Unless yet again, they don't know and no one cares. Enough people would go there anyway (until one day they'd stop...). Well, I won't.

eoI09r2kBtlLUwdpP1xpYg.text: Foodgasmic oysters and king crab legs!!  Seriously, they are MIND-BLOWING amazing!  I am a lover of fresh seafood, especially oysters and crab legs; it is very rare to find oysters and crab legs that blow my mind because it all essentially tastes the same.  That said, I also had a range of very good, good enough and blech dishes at the same meal; hence, the 4 stars.  OK AMBIENCE.  We have seen Baku numerous times on our way to South Park Mall and wondered if it was like Zuma (my BFs all-time favorite restaurant upon which all other pan-Asian | Asian fusion restaurants are compared).  The answer?  Not quite.  There is a cute patio outside that was much too hot for us to enjoy, maybe next time.    Inside, it tries to be trendy and hip like a Morimoto, Hakkasan or any other modern vibey LA/Miami Asian restaurant but sort of falls flat and feels a little dated and underwhelming.  I can't quite put my finger on what makes me feel this way, maybe the really bad lighting or the cramped quarters (even though the restaurant was sparsely attended).  It just didn't feel upscale (and not in the minimalist way either).   MEDIOCRE SERVICE.  The service was exactly on par with what you would expect from an upscale restaurant.   There was nothing remarkable about the service.  They can improve by wiping down the table between courses when they're clearing off the plates.  This isn't something that I usually notice but if I feel like I need to put my napkin on top of my table, that's a really good sign that it needs a good wipe down.  Overall, the service was fine; our food was served, cleared away and drinks refilled promptly and courteously.    ALCOHOL.  We had a Moscow mule and a fruity concoction that I asked the bartender to prepare; they were heavy on the alcohol pour but mixed wonderfully as to maintain their intended flavors.    A WIDE ARRAY OF CULINARY PERFORMANCE.  If it weren't for the oysters and crab legs, I may have given the experience 3 or 3.5 stars, right around average.  I've had:   AMAZING:  +++  oysters. When they were served, we were told to be prepared to have the best oyster experience ever. He was absolutely right.  I usually want to throw all the fixings on: cocktail sauce, horseradish, tabasco, salt, pepper, and lime -- but the sweetness, and the soft buttery texture of these divine oysters eradicated the need for the extras.  It was like these oysters weren't farmed in the ocean at all, they didn't have any salty or gritty texture to them at all; truly,  they were unlike any of their usual counterparts. +++  Alaskan crab legs. The crab legs were meaty, sweet and didn't have a fishy aftertaste at all.  They serve it in this heavenly lemon butter ponzu sauce that just perfectly complements the sweetness.  The portion is huge enough that my BF and I barely polished it off.    VERY GOOD:  +++  crispy rock shrimp.  The shrimps were crispy and served with a hot mustard sauce, very similar to Zuma. +++  traditional miso. It threw me off that it's sweet and a little sour but the fresh scallops in it really made me grow fond of it.   +++  spicy tuna roll. Very fresh, densely complex and quite spicy.    OK:  +++  yellowtail.  You get three rolled up pieces.  This is fine if it was more complex than plain yellowtail such as a nice ponzu sauce or crispy tempura flakes (like Zuma does); it was good but not stellar.   +++  panacotti.  The fruit panacotti had vanilla custard that was pretty bland.  I'm not one for over decadent sweetness but the panacotti seemed to err at the opposite spectrum and left my palate wanting more.   BLECH:  +++  salmon tatake.  I LOVE albacore tatake that sits on a semi-sweet citrus ponzu sauce with stripped daikon.  This wasn't it.  The salmon is cooked, even with the fresh crab,  it's really not the right texture to turn into a tatake.   +++  mango toffee.  Too many nuts, the very dense cake didn't taste like mango -- Starbucks could have done a better dessert.   +++  pork belly.  The pieces are REALLY fatty and greasy; not in the savory bacon (yum!) way.  COME FOR THE OYSTERS AND CRAB LEGS.   If the oysters and king crab had been your run-of-the-mill variety, we probably wouldn't return because other than that, the only thing we would order again are the crispy shrimp.  However, the oysters and king crab legs are absolutely incredible and worth every penny of their market price tag.    10.7.2016 Update.  We went for a second time on a rainy Friday night and because it was busier, the service was slower.  I'd skip the desserts altogether next time.    I can see why others say that the portions are not commensurate to the hefty price tag.  I will definitely vouch for the freshness and premium quality of their seafood (for example, in contrast, Cowfish uses imitation crab in their rolls).  That being said,  if you come here, stick to the popular food items or fresh sushi because not everything on their menu will otherwise garner a satiating dining experience.

ROGWtP4lgG2Zlawu2_AjhQ.text: The only reason we went to Baku was because our neighbor gave us a gift card there. For some reason I wasn't interested in it, but now I am really glad we got that gift card, because it was a really enjoyable experience.   We sat upstairs in an area that seems like the bar/lounge section, and it was nice. Our server was lights out (baseball reference).  She was on top of everything, extremely friendly and helpful, and all of her suggestions were great.  It was Friday night, so I am guessing she was on their A squad.   The menu has tons of small plate variety, and it seemed like everything we ordered was great.  Chicken meatballs, NY strip tataki, corn, kimchi, pork dumplings, etc.  Our server said they cook the food over some imported hot stones (I only eat off the finest stones)...which I guess is a good thing, because everything tasted great.   For dessert, I highly recommend the truffles.  There are a lot of good things happening in this dessert. The presentation of the food is excessive and awesome (ice everywhere, food floating on various towers, and I think I saw some gold bullion in the background). The actual dessert tastes great, too. The truffles taste like chocolate batter and they come in this almond brittle cup.  There is also this ice cream perched on top of an ice sculpture, which is no slouch either.  We'll definitely be back to Baku in the near future,

LDFG8el6DGKhPwo4enblBw.text: This was my second time eating at Baku and this time it was for Charlotte restaurant week. The selected menu is $35 plus $5 extra for dessert.  First off I love the ambiance of this restaurant. It's quiet and spacious which makes it super enjoyable for a romantic date night or night out with friends.  We got the Himachi (done both ways), pork dumplings, crispy brussel sprouts, NY strip, Salmon and split the chocolate cake for dessert. The apps were incredible and the Himachi (sashimi style and spicy atop a fried rice cake) were to die for. Everything came out quick, hot and in waves which I love when sharing plates. The only thing I was disappointed about was the dessert. It was not worth the extra $5. The portion size and dessert itself was mediocre.   The rest of the portions and plates were incredible. Simplistic but complex and definitely delicious! Will definitely be back!

DkxTVZ11bVj2NVK438fPaA.text: We went here as a group today, Sunday, since it was open later for whatever reason and it. Was. Banginnnnnnn' .  Miss Alex was our server and she was on pointtttt.   Food came out quickly and was soooooooo delicious!!! Presentation was oh so nicely done.  Shall be back for our server Alex, yummy food, AMAZINGGGGG DESSERT, and the sweet corn.

VWl4wruTIbu_jpn6m-Z8yg.text: The most talked-about Japanese restaurant in Charlotte ,Fly there for Tiesto at World,have a dinner with best friend at Baku , Guess what ,Tiesto is right there @ Baku  Great Food ,Great Service

5TsrORdA02pKf58PTNt2JA.text: Baku was good, but somewhat expensive. I understand that the Japanese charcoal cooking method is unique and more costly. Not a bad experience. Just wasn't a wow.

Eh7_1OMAojNNQfJTd13Djg.text: Amazing selection. Three words. Salmon Belly Nigiri. I travel for business and have had sushi in some of the best restaurants in LA, Vegas, NYC and more, and this might be the best tasting Nigiri I have ever had.

s43_hUOZqpxejGtn1Z8WfA.text: I've visited Charlotte several times and always wanted to try this place. Well, I finally did a couple weeks ago and unfortunately I wasn't impressed. Our group of four ordered:  Rock Shrimp: The sauce served on the side is a little different from what I've had at other places, too much mayo. But anything fried tastes good :-) Wild Mushroom rice pot: Best dish we ordered and the most filling. Get this! Omakase (for 4 people for $20/each): beautifully presented and so fresh, but there's literally one piece for each person. So 4 octopus, 4 salmon, 4 oysters, etc (see pic) Chicken/Onion Yakitori: A little salty, had too many burnt edges. Still good enough to eat. Pea Blossom Maki Roll: 6 small pieces. nothing memorable   While the food was good and the seafood was fresh it just didn't blow me away. At these prices- either increase the portion size, have amazing top notch service, or decrease your prices.  Also, there was a piece of hair weaved into the basket our rock shrimp was served in. We immediately told our server, and he brought out a new batch. However, it would have been nice if he had communicated that dish would be comp'ed bc the whole time we were thinking how bad the service is since most restaurants would comp it. Only later to find out when the bill came they did comp it! But it's pointless when you're in a bad mood throughout the entire meal.   Another minor incident was a dirty sauce dish. Glad we noticed before using it for our sushi!  Maybe it was just an off day...but I just can't justify the food and prices when I can get the same thing in ATL for so much cheaper and better service!  Fyi- the guys were still hungry, so they each ate a bowl of pho afterwards. LOL

NjB1qtTVepb1ETZcJyW94g.text: We have been to Baku twice and both times have been blown away. This is the BEST sushi in Charlotte - hands down!  The quality of the fish is unreal, but the creativity takes it up multiple notches. This is now our favorite date night spot. The salmon belly sashimi has such amazing flavor that we start and END with it. I want the flavors to linger in my mouth and mind until we get to visit again. Sit at the sushi bar, the chefs are great and will help customize dishes. I'm allergic to shellfish and my husband isn't so they customized a roll to have half with and half without. No other sushi restaurant has ever done that. Can't wait until our next visit.

nyK6Jnyk4rGNMJpN9VDgFQ.text: Went with a friend who likes sushi to this restaurant. Made a reservation on OpenTable and when we arrived the restaurant was virtually empty and they asked if we wanted to be seated upstairs for some reason. We ask to be seated downstairs  and throughout the meal the restaurant was still virtually empty .  I ordered the salmon and the brussel sprouts. The salmon entree arrived and half of it was raw. The brussel sprouts were the leafs of the sprouts and very few solid pieces of Brussel sprouts. This was a side dish for $9  My friend enjoyed her sushi. Menus left on the table for our entire meal and had to ask twice to have water glasses refilled.  The wine was excellent.

5kW1IBRZlReDk60WT6hUgg.text: Their food is amazing! Recommend the uni spoon and tuna tartar! Also the sashimi is so fresh! Worth of your money!

c8n0z0cGis3E48zGOaQsTg.text: The food was delicious! My wife and I started with a few appetizers and some sushi and loved every bite. We then ordered a couple of steaks, which were delicious! SoNS-WJwQNzBYgo3qjAB0w.text: We came here for Charlotte restaurant week last night. We ordered the edamame and Brussels sprouts, both were very good. Next course we got the maki and the calamari. The sushi was awesome but they only give you 4 tiny pieces!  And finally our main courses were served, salmon and steak for my husband. mNXhtV-1kEVmftWP2Wy5BQ.text: The theme of this place is cool, the restaurant is kind of sexy, the service is excellent, and the presentation of the food is unique and fun. The food itself though is pretty standard, so it feels bad to have to pay so much for it. This is a one time place for me, I don't regret it, I enjoyed it but I can similar quality food elsewhere for cheaper. Boom.

1RqJCBkyOEMttO60_RDZfw.text: Didn't think you have to get reservation to eat sushi or eat at normal table! When it wasn't even busy nor it was no info on website that you have reservations to eat a normal table. Service was okay, sushi is about average! Nothing to scream about, pricey for what you pay for! I think twice before I go there or maybe not!

gB8vuu_uwuf9y6Fqlubibg.text: I have to agree with David d. The taste, quality and price are completely misguided. 24 dollar rolls should make me dance around in delight, not think i should have gone to Cowfish.  And having loud drunk grown women at the bar screaming in a lounge atmosphere is in poor taste.....and so is having grown women so drunk that one vomitted on the top of the stairs last night. ZiBBgM9D1Xf3Xsv638QI6Q.text: Great atmosphere, service, happy hour alone are reasons to frequent Baku, but they are just the tip of the 'berg. My favorite feature is the food presentation. The chefs go out of their way to make every dish seem like a special. Seared Scallops with Foie Gras, Roasted Quail, Toro Tartare, anything Wagyu comes with truffle. Don't get me started on the sushi. Find a reason to eat at Baku !

SjmXpHPUQAmI7fi2qlWhlw.text: It took me three years but I finally found it, a spot that serves good, GREAT, sushi in Charlotte. It's Baku. The sashimi and sea urchin melts in your mouth. Yes, melts in your mouth.

n8RdBb5br2joX1KwYTfBtw.text: Ordered the tiger prawn last night to accompany a salad & wine BUT I was brought shrimp tempura instead; without any questions or explanation of the substitution. Not sure if they thought I wouldn't notice, but I definitely do know the difference between a PRAWN and a factory farmed SHRIMP. lol

r6gIstjfkiVNNpzoyd-yGg.text: Baku is a baby born in a different city. Something charlotte has needed for years. Its pricey, but depending on your selection, it doesn't have to be. The food is insanely good, with a robata grill that doesnt disappoint. 25 specialty cocktails has something for everyone...a True gem amongst a typical crowd of charlotte run of the mill/generic repeats. The interior design shows True effort across the board. A welcomed addition to the southpark area.

WA4VO1e_KxN1NdqyA6e95Q.text: This place is amazing! Great service, atmosphere,  and crafted cocktails!  The food is awesome with intricate and full flavors. Lots of vegetarian and vegan options that are not just a last minute effort to please vegans. Pricey, but worth every penny!

qXk7NNY33qI1Rbn52BNtkg.text: OK, we moved out of Southpark and have little reason to want to go back (just a boutique or two for me). Tried Baku again. Small bites, Calamari, Beef & Asparagus & their incredible mushrooms. Not nearly the crowd they once had. We don't order the Chicken Yakatori anymore since I found myself chewing and swallowing what I suddenly realized was chicken cooked on the outside and raw on the inside. I panicked then (last thing I need is Salmonella) & our server said they had just sent an order of that back for the same reason - there is a special way to cook done on the Robata grill, and if they get it wrong (chefs keep changing - not master chef I think but whoever is on the Robata, and they mess up). And again I reiterate - THEY KEEP BLASTING THIS HORRIFIC, ELECTRONIC, DARK AND MISERY INDUCING MUSIC. We sat outside before 6PM when nobody was there, so we asked they turn it way down outside. It was done and someone then turned it way back up. This is a pricey place, supposed to be a Japanese restaurant and any music should be soft, melodic and Japanese - not ELECTRONIC DRECK. Staff were all wonderful, so who is the nincompoop who insists on blasting lousy "music" that has no place anywhere other than a PORNO FLICK? Mr. "Owner" - are you listening, or are you just one of those "old boys club" guys who currently run this town/city? You are getting slammed on your salon Cutting Image and your casual BBQ place "Tree House".? No plans to go back to any of them. Better give a raise to your staff, I don't know how they can stand working there, they must all be good actors.

xknsXdC3dVVt3h2TfCZNjg.text: This is a review specifically for the Queen's Feast (Charlotte restaurant week).  Some restaurants really give the vibe that they do not enjoy the 10 days of the Queen's Feast.  This is most readily apparent in their menu, where they are outright stingy in their selections of what is available or plaster the menu with upcharges.  Very offputting.  Delightfully, Baku is NOT one of those.   It has a reputation for being a bit spendy, but they really don't hold back on the restaurant week selections.  We thoroughly enjoyed the salad course, the small plate course and the entree course.  Someone looking for volume of food might cast a critical eye -- Baku is a small plate concept.   But we appreciate quality over that and Baku delivered in spades.  The NY Strip was the big winner, though my m-i-l very much enjoyed her salmon.  Excellent preparation and presentation.    Sometimes a wait staff can make the Queen's Feast unpleasant as well, perhaps allowing the smaller check size to sour their attitude.  Again Baku came through with top marks.  Our staff was prompt, accurate and engaging.  Thoroughly enjoyed our first trip to Baku.  We will be back.  This is what restaurant week is supposed to be about.

B_rLeio5N-VcL18p5pxnkA.text: The Taylor Swift knockoff at the hostess stand acted like she was doing us a favor by asking us how she could help. We went for Charlotte Restaurant Week and found the service slow. The food was OK, if not overly Americanized. I would try again but there's much more attentive and friendly service in the area.

A1SBbmc_tQoPbu-Zs4dwBA.text: Baku is named after a mythological dragon who eats bad dreams - my interest was immediately piqued after learning this.   I've been to Baku twice and never been disappointed by the cuisine or the breathtaking atmosphere. It's about time Charlotte gained an upscale establishment that isn't reeking of played out trends or beating that dead (and stuffy!) fine dining horse that should've been laid to rest years ago.  The Jidori Chicken breast was tender and savory, the mugi and miso soy glaze gives it a robust flavor that isn't overbearing or painfully salty as is the trend in some lesser establishments. The Day Boat Grouper Bites, Rock Shrimp Tempura and Tiger Prawns are tempura done perfectly - light and flaky, super fresh and unweighed down by excess greasiness or breading. I haven't had Red Miso soup since Nobu in NYC and was pleasantly surprised by Baku's take on Miso's not so common cousin. The Sweet Potato was also cooked perfectly - not stringy or undercooked, not drenched in sugar - and complimented our sushi (delicious yellowtail sashimi sliced thinly enough to melt in your mouth) amazingly well. However, my absolute favorite dish at Baku is the Giant Madagascar Prawn, hands down. I could eat a million of them and never get tired of them. Absolutely flawless.  The only thing I didn't love about Baku was the clearly condescending vibe given off by the Management. Guests seem to bug them and co-workers seem to bug them even more. A couple of people have commented on the posse of hosts that seem to be almost forcibly planted at the front door eager to open the door for you even when they're not busy at all which is, yeah... awkward. Add impersonal, nearly hawklike managers and you've got a slightly uninviting ushering in.  I haven't gotten the slightest clue what's up with that - Baku's food is heavenly, the atmosphere is killer, servers have always been efficient and helpful and hosts nothing but friendly and hospitable.

cAoTaCXGYTXSo6WtAzuTdg.text: Very expensive! Very little portions!  Oysters smaller than a quarter!  Only positive is the presentation is beautiful. Expect to leave broke and hungry!!!!!!!

xbTCGfDMqgwRaG3pgSUfmQ.text: Baku is arguably the best restaurant in North Carolina.

GoADhZGq230kYOAE2Hha5Q.text: Loved this place! We sat at the bar, had several different appetizers. Everything was delicious and we and had outstanding service! We will be back !! Also, great help was the gentleman that helped us select which sake to have for the evening!

0DQvuRd5rEzuknbo3vC7_Q.text: Don't bother! Pretentious, over rated, and boring. Just keep driving or go back home and make Ramen Noodles.

QT-G3XRlF5AOExwOuwLOLA.text: Food was good but EXTREMELY small portions. Way too $$ for food. Paid $17 for 2, yes 2 scallops. No sides.  Glad we tried in once. Many other fancy places in Southpark that feed us more!

EihFByHEPI7ROQCfsh-Heg.text: Been there twice since it opened. Tried about 10 dishes on the menu. I thought it was going to be better the 2nd time, but NOT!  Really way over priced for what you get. Nothing really impressive. They spend a lot of money on wait staff..they are very quick to take away your dishes, even when you are not even done. You wait a long time between dishes...so few of us in the party just sat and watched while others ate their dinner plate. What a mess! If you want to spend that much money, go to Zebra next door and get better food. Or spend less and go to Yama or Cowfish! Will not go back again.

r7IDvLy0jQuQIArzq9rBMA.text: Amazing restaurant. Always great service and awesome food. The Blue fin toro tartare is quite delicious. Huge selection of sake. One of the best restaurants in Charlotte.

9iatFHoF3x1wD4CZ-4tgAQ.text: I am and African American woman and I consider myself a food connoisseur, hey let's  face it,  I love to eat! First let me start by saying I read these reviews and decided to give it a try anyway what a great choice!  From the time I walked in to the time I left I felt like a VIP, the ambiance was great, the atmosphere was comfortable and relaxing.   The food is BETTER than delicious when I say my taste buds were dancing,  they were dancing! EVERYTHING I ate from the Miso soup to the  Dragon Roll to the Sweet Roll to the Beef with asparagus to the Honey glazed chicken skewers to the  the Duck was tasteful  & full of flavor and again made my taste buds danced you got to definitely top it off with a dessert, I had the chocolate lava cake with caramel ice cream perfect combination absolutely delicious every single penny spent was well worth it! if I would give it a 10 If I could! Shout out to my waitresses Leanne and Amber who knew the menu top to bottom

A5LPcyettNNSBvpL-QQ4Ng.text: Great food, intelligent service (they know the menu, flavors, and options), and ambiance. Good wine choices!

KDmsAYHj_-XoSXlOok3CaQ.text: Extremely refined food.  The blue fin toro nigiri with osetra caviar was luxurious.  Great cocktails and great wine list.  New to the neighborhood and will return.

hzkjFd46d3YYOoP4lt9SlQ.text: Tried this place for restaurant week....not impressed. Had a larger party of about 12. Waiter tried to upsell to chefs choice menu and told us the rest. week option wasn't going to be that good. Honestly he was right.....the Brussels sprouts were horrific. Burnt, bitter and not edible. Changed to the salad which was good with ginger dressing. About an hour after our apps we were served our dinners....all but one of my gfs. We all were about finished with our dinners when she finally got hers. To say the least, service was ok. Food was a huge let down. Too expensive and so many places to eat in Charlotte to have such mediocre food.

4kNYre4mQfYVqSkGys3QLg.text: I have now eaten at Baku three times and it is fantastic.  The downstairs is a warm inviting restaurant setting and upstairs is a little more raucous.  So if you like the loud music and more a club feel, go upstairs.  If you prefer a quieter experience, stay downstairs.  As for the food, the menu is very big.  It was a little intimidating the first time and I spent too much time worrying  over what to order.  My advice is each person pick 3 or 4 things and then sit back and relax.  Things will come out as they are ready so delicious surprises show up at your table at a steady pace.  And trust the pairings your chef makes!  One of my favorites was the scallops with foie gras that came with some pickled plum.  Who knew but just a little of that plum with it made it perfect!  Try and be a little adventurous and let your servers help you with suggestions.  They have been spot on.  You can ring up a big tab here.  There are definitely some really pricey items.  But there are also plenty of reasonably priced things as well.    I have no complaints about the wait staff.  They have been courteous, helpful and knowledgeable every time.

tTQh12nytRBjrVkOsSEpmg.text: so amazing.   seared scallops with foie gras. a5 wagyu. this giant shrimp looking thing. this mushroom rice hot pot thing.  ok... so I clearly did not participate in the ordering. I just sat there and looked pretty(ish) and ate what was brought. but it was all so so so good. great lighting (helped with looking prettyish), great service, and the place was "jumping."

tO7qCgjvhOp4K7UM0vcEbg.text: There is not much I enjoyed about this restaurant. I will start with what I did like. The patio, it had a lot of shade, great atmosphere and comfortable seating. With that being said we had to wait a long time before we were greeted by our server. I am going to give them the benefit of the doubt and say they were not informed that we had been seated out there, even still quite a few other servers walked by a few times and they didn't even notice or offer to get someone for us. The sushi we ordered was not good at all. Especially for how expensive it was. If you like traditional sushi this is not the restaurant for you.  The saki was good but again, over priced.

MoZ-aWXlWnmpxmK-kjsV6Q.text: Wow!  Amazing taste and presentation. I eat all over the country with business, and all I can say is Wow!  Great Food! This is the place to wow a date or a business partner!  I ordered about 10 items off the menu and everything was great!  Try this place and you will be back again and again.

QUEElkgpYuW9pdDi1NFTxA.text: Quality was good. Presentation was beautiful. Service was ok. They should've changed out our plates at least once during dinner as our plates were drenched in oils and flavors from the other dishes. The Uni Spoon ($10/each) was my favorite... had the perfect amount of caviar, truffle and uni, and the blend with the ponzu and quail egg was great! The A5-12 Japanese Wagyu Beef Nigiri ($8/pierce) with Burgundy Truffle and Hon Shiso was another one of my favorites.   I was very disappointed in the Salmon Belly Nigiris as that was what drew me into wanting to go to this restaurant. The salmon belly was fresh but the flavor was off because the chef had a big dab of mayonnaise on each piece.  The flavors did not go together and the mayonnaise took away the flavor of the fish. I feel that this was my main problem with this restaurant... the combination of flavors just did not go together. They would have fresh ingredients that are amazing even all on its own but then they would add something that overpowers the main ingredient. Another example was the yellowtail sashimi ($12 for 3 pieces)... the yellowtail was great, the truffle ponzu sauce was great but then they added this overpowering pickled smoky onion in it which in my opinion, totally ruined the dish and seems like such a waste of good quality fish. They could've added some onions but not so much where it was more than the fish itself. Another example was the Foiegras and Scallop dish ($28 for 2)... foiegras.. perfectly cooked, flavor was great... scallop... perfectly cooked, flavor was on point... and then they add this mint leaf that tasted like licorice in the middle which totally caught me by surprise and added this overpowering, pungent flavor that had a bitter aftertaste. Overall, good experience but disappointed in the dishes I was most excited to try.

Z5E1mMDJjY0s0YkiHrHltw.text: We ordered the toro tartare appetizer and a sashimi platter for our entree and it was honestly the best fish I've had thus far!

5XwpuNuPdJ-bqUvv_3fpcg.text: I went to Baku with a local Charlotte friend who knew I was a foodie and thought I would appreciate this Japanese inspired restaurant.  Upon reaching the front door it was opened for us by a waitress who welcomed us with a smile.  We were seated in the main dining area (there is a lounge-y space upstairs).  It was a Tuesday night around 8:30 pm and the space was surprisingly full.  Subdued in its decorations, perfectly lighted so that you could clearly see what you ordered, the restaurant could easily exist in New York City or any other major metropolitan area.  Service was impeccable - our main waitress was attentive and genuinely enthusiastic.  A bevy of support folks attended our table as well.  It was evident that the owners were rigorous in their expectations for the front of the house and that staff were willing to execute in order to make those expectations happen.  My friend and I decided on a small plates for our meal.  I must say that I was somewhat put off by the voluminous menu; it had to have been 10 pages (including 3 pages of sake and other drinks) as well as 2 additional separate menus of "specials."  So there were 3 menus in all!  I  felt like I needed to have studied and prepared prior to arrival.  It was a little overwhelming.  In the end, I questioned our waitress for recommendations which she was more than happy to do.  Along with cold sake (1/2 price bottles that evening YAY!), we had 8 small plates; each presented with a rigorous attention to detail.  You could tell these were chef conceived items and that he ran a tight ship.  From the sake bottle resting in an ice filled wooden box onward, every element of the food and its presentation is the vision of the chef.  We had first a plate of homemade kimchi, the cabbage tart and vinegary.  It was followed by a Hamachi dish - two thinly sliced pieces of delectably fresh fish atop a pickled mound of crunchy veg.  I would have liked a larger piece of fish as it was dwarfed by the pickled mound and kind of lost.  Charred baby octopus followed, plated in a long white ceramic runway.  Tasty and delicious, it offered a wonderful bite.  A tuna tartare was next, to be scooped up with homemade taro chips.  The chips were an unexpected item, a nice touch - the tartare; weak of seasoning fell flat as merely mushy.  We then had tempura shrimp.  When it came out, I was at first disappointed by the size of the shrimp - smallish and popcorn - like.  But after popping one in my mouth, I was amazed at how they remained so succulent and juicy after being deep-fried.  But they were.  And the tempura batter, thin and crisp, did not overpower.  A really delicious dish.  Next came pork belly with sous vide egg.  The pork belly was prepared nicely, fatty and flavorful.  I was very disappointed in the egg though as it was cold.  I told my waitress to let the chef know as I was sure he did not intend the warmth of the fatty delicious pork belly to be paired and eaten with a refrigerator-cold egg yolk.  I looked at my friend and said just you wait - a chef this meticulous would send us another so that we could enjoy as he intended.  He didn't - oh well.  Last we had scallops with foie gras.   It contained two big meaty succulent sea scallops adorned with slivers of foie gras, some sea salt and pickled plum on the side.  This was a winner; a choreographed ending to the savory portion of the meal.  Lastly, but not least - I had to have a dessert.  I ordered the chocolate ganache  cake with homemade coconut ice cream.  Need I say more?  A brilliant pairing - the cake's center was warm and gooey and the ice cream cold and coconutty - combined the two were unified into a wonderful yummy finale to the meal.

yiY6alg2NPzcJMaJ38OdYw.text: Excellent Japanese food/sushi. Excellent service. Lovely and warm ambiance. The calamari is amazing and tender. The chili edamame was delicious and the wild mushroom Kamamashi pot is a must clean and earthy. Salmon belly was exquisite. We will be back

owiRPafOpNbLpXpAwxup5g.text: The food here is excellent!!! I have been here about 6 time now and it has always been above par. The service is just as good as well. HOWEVER, the last time I was here the 2 young hostess had a serious issue with I guess being at work on a weekend. They were extremely rude to my party and I and gave us stank looks the entire time as we were seated in the front.  With that being said I will no longer be visiting this establishment. But again the food is amazing the the wait staff lives up to the expectation you should come to expect within that price range.

pem9mpf9FJLW6Uo-TGWdDQ.text: The most expensive food I have ever paid for the "type of food"  Great atmosphere but I would probably attend this place only for drinks instead of fine dinning.  I don't mind paying high prices as long as I get quality back and some quality as well.  Sushi - I've had a lot better sushi for not even half of what they charge  Lamb - it was great actually but if you need to get somewhat satisfied you need to order 5 of those plates and your bill will be over $200 like mine . ..  Summary - great atmosphere and great to be social with drinks with friends etc. Get an appetizer to accommodate your drinks but skip the meal

XpkigqOA48jl1Lvs2t-hhg.text: Someone led us to this awesome place. They got really wonderful sushi and sashimi. Roast beef and chicken are also yummy. The only drawback is that it's a little expensive hh.

SAUCKoWh6FHXLlWhxiakmA.text: Japanese Fusion... Went there for my Wife's Birthday with her Brother and my Sister-in-Law... Excellent! A bit pricey, but Excellent... The food was amazing, the service was amazing and the desserts were also - Amazing! The Best Sazerac I have ever had! Highly recommend, we will go back.

yblgkmXzJ8y9rDAJmwB00g.text: Holy moly! Come hungry...and with a lot of money. Ha! It's expensive, but SO WORTH IT. Charlotte needed a cool establishment like this. Especially for an Asian aficionado like myself, I am always on a lookout for cool Asian food that is perfectly prepared and artistically presented. Think Asian tapas, and remember that they will be small portions. The server recommended that we each order 3 or 4 plates. The plates range from about 10-30. See what I mean about expensive? But one taste of the pork belly, and you'll be emptying your wallet on the table and summoning the waiter for more! Arigato!

TUNEUpc07Dz6uJxWHpDzCA.text: Historically one of my wife and I's favorite places to visit especially on special occasions.  We went this past Saturday evening and had a very poor experience.  Reservation was made.  We were seated upstairs by the bar which was quite loud.   Dining room was requested upon arrival.  Gentlemen, not our waiter, promptly brought us some water.  We then waited about 15 minutes before our actual waiter greeted us and began service.  Things were progressing fine until our second course arrived in which we found a hair in it.  Waited another 15 minutes before our waiter returned and at that time we informed of the "hair".  She saw it and made a horrific face and swiftly removed the dish.  Another was brought in its place, which was fine except there was no apology, no one came to speak with us, no comp, etc...  If the hair wasn't enough for a poor rating the service made it so.  It may not have been our servers fault as she appeared to be overwhelmed and possibly understaffed.    We will not be returning.

8x0QnyScwWWCqBMoARnH-g.text: Didn't have reservation only had to wait 10 minutes they were really friendly especially we had two kids with us . But the food was really delicious from the appetizer to the main course . Try 3 different drinks which were really yummy . The whole evening was great will definitely be returning .

838AdDeL_P6HmIzndHVkog.text: Came in on a Weekend, this place is not busy. Food is relatively low quality compare to the price they charged.

xE9x9E7yStdj-6cN6EWMNw.text: After hearing many mixed reviews on this restaurant, I finally got to experience Baku.  For starters, as expected, the restaurant was indeed stylish...a cozy mix of rustic and city-chic decor.  Then came THE disappointment for the entire dining experience...the TINY table.  As I often dine out with my husband, it's fairly normal that we get the smaller tables in  most restaurants, but here at Baku, the table for two seemed a tad smaller than norm.  It might not have bothered me much if we simply opted for simple entree plates.  However, as recommended by the waiter, this was a restaurant that specialized in smaller plates (AKA tapas-style!).  Since the menu did feature many tantalizing appetizers and tapas-style items, we proceeded ordering at least half a dozen plates, along with soup, dessert and drinks.  Our table was completely overwhelmed...and honestly, it was an aggravating, near-claustrophobic foodie experience.  The menu was delightful, with many unique items...and all the foods were delicious.  I do want to add that some of their items, like the sushi that I ordered was way overpriced for what it was...but again, delicious.  Also, the waiter was very good...an obvious pro with years of experience.  Overall, I did like what Baku had to offer.  If my dining experience was more comfortable (bigger table!), I might have even given this 5 stars.

Mnf87q8o8wJ6E4FmEbPEmg.text: Yeeeaaaa I mean it's aight. Came here for Restaurant week with my peoples and the ambience is nice. Our waiter attempted to be funny with his little light jokes. They weren't really landing, but I appreciate the friendly attitude. Five star attitude, but the food was 3 stars.   The Brussels sprouts were hittin it. They taste just like the sprouts at Futo Buta. I don't know who ripped who off and I don't care, because truthfully that was the highlight of my meal.   The dumplings were aight. Something was off to me. Like the spices didn't meld well for me.   The salmon was actually pretty good with the side salad and sweet potatoes. The salmon was cooked medium and really fresh. I'm glad they serve Wild Caught because I don't do farm raised. The potatoes were soft and seasoned well. I liked the slice of lemon which I sprayed all over my dish.   Now unfortunately the portions were so small I had to order what was supposed to be a chocolate cake. The waiter recommended this and I was like "Bet" I'm bout to top my night off with something sweet and this will make up for the small toddler food portions of food I just got.   {Sigh} I think I got duped because my friggin cake tasted like one of those Little Debbie cakes. I paid $5 and could have purchased a box of cakes for the same flavor.   I never heard too much about this place but in my opinion it's overrated for the prices.   ... on to the next spot...

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy Brussels Sprouts

Yxft28bkZHCZh2dpp4b8GA.text: The waiter seems very busy but there are not many people in the restaurant. The spoons and plates are not clean. They are out of several dishes on the menu.

djHZsnr_uP6ZMhRWi6HQhw.text: Giving this place 5 stars for a couple reasons. First of all the ambience is fantastic!!!! We went upstairs after dining at different establishment to meet friends. They had a certain food that only comes in season rarely *not going to mention ;)  this item had already been purchased as a gift for someone. The owner was contacted and nice enough to let us have a small sample!!! I've only been here for a couple drinks and a couple samples of our friends food but will certainly be back.

nQROl4wjBMNkaZsL3l6sEw.text: We were so incredibly pleased with our Restaurant Week experience at Baku! The food was great, portions were reasonable (I'd heard otherwise) and our server, Bob, was fantastic! We enjoyed it so much we took advantage of the Queens Feast AAA special on our way out and bought $200 worth of gift cards for $100. So, we'll be back, Baku!   To the food... We shared the edamame, crispy brussel sprouts, fried calamari, petite nigiri, salmon, skirt steak, pear fortune cookies and chocolate truffles with raspberry coulis. The ONLY dish I didn't love was the salmon but I am admittedly a picky salmon eater. My favorite of the night was the skirt steak, hands down. A big, 8-oz. portion, perfectly cooked and served with a yummy dipping sauce. Runner up was the nigiri -- each piece came topped with something different (a dill cream on the salmon, cilantro on the tuna, etc.) that really highlighted the flavor and freshness of each piece of fish.   The atmosphere was fun! We were in a booth towards the back (near the samurai room -- aka men's bathroom) which allowed for conversation with our friends. The restaurant is dark and has a swanky feel. Glad I decided to wear a dress. Felt like a real night out on the town! But, for only $35.00 per person thanks to Queens Feast! I'm withholding my 5th star until I visit outside of restaurant week and can judge regular menu items and service.

Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken app
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Edamame (Restaurant Week selection)

VZ6ChNVbgeDzLWzxiCBMtg.text: Overpriced, average food. The Toro appetizer was mushy with a tiny drop of caviar, inexplicably served with limp sweet potato chips. Ridiculously priced at $25. The sushi and sashimi were served oddly; I received half of my sashimi order while still eating my appetizer. Turns out, the waiter incorrectly took my order. The sushi rolls, one each for my dinner companion and myself, were served on the same plate. Snow crab and a salmon roll. Again, average. Dessert was a slice of Green tea cheesecake smaller than my cell phone. It came with black sesame ice cream for $9. Overall, not a good experience.

CE2Cb_ayoL95r8hM1kI9Lw.text: Yum! Bartender was attentive and all the food ordered was very delicious. I would highly recommend this place for some great sushi (especially the roll with the wagyu beef on top).

5Vrt_6yus7FK3GWzu3JrJQ.text: This is the best restaurant in Charlotte if you are looking for quality sushi and the steak is to die for. The staff is very friendly and you get to enjoy a meal in a relaxing atmosphere with family.

B9SZdUxA1BaTekLtwVy0DQ.text: Had reservation at 9pm, we were seated right away. It took the waiter about 8 minutes to greet us, which gave us a bad taste right away. Thankfully the waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and the food, and was patient with our questions. Food was excellent!! We had five plates between the two of us and everything was delicious. No complaints at all, had a great experience, I will definitely be back.

XE3b5fZSw11DqBDYlpr5Og.text: I would just like to say that the service here is excellent. My boyfriend took me to Baku for my birthday dinner because I have been wanting to try it so bad. I've heard great things about this restaurant. I came about 30 minutes earlier than my boyfriend so I sat at the bar on the 2nd floor to grab a drink. Monica has to be one of the most greatest bartenders I've met in awhile. She is very easy to talk to. Once my boyfriend arrived, we were served by Maria. She was an excellent server - very respectful & attentive. For the food, we had quite a few things. I honestly don't remember the names of it all but I do remember getting the Brussels sprouts! ABSOLUTELY AMAZING & highly recommendable. I also got the teriyaki chicken which tasted good but I honestly wish it came with rice. I got the Salmon King roll and it is awesome! The flavors just go so well. We also got the spicy tuna Rice Krispies which was different but good. I recommend Baku and will be here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States

0SD2JBDZEJtouu7vp77O-Q.text: Baku was our ABSOLUTE FAVORITE when the restaurant first opened years ago. I was OBSESSED and bragged to my whole network about it. I mean, I was excited to post content on my IG to share our experience. I've my celebrated birthdays, even planned birthdays and bachelorette dinners there. Once we noticed our friends were not as impressed, it was a disappointment.   Baku to me was not only known for their unique menu, but it was known for the Baku "experience".   My last birthday event was December 2015. After my party of 28 were all disappointed in the service.   Last week we decided to give it another chance for our anniversary. The waitress was nice, but food was bland!  My favorite sides were sweet potatoes and grilled corn.  The potatoes were undercooked, corn wasn't seasoned, Sushi was bland, pork belly didn't taste as good as it used to, Kumamoto oysters were a disappointment, (especially after the cost) Shrimp skewers were dry, grilled grouper was slimy... and drinks were not crafted like they used to be.   For a 200.00 meal, we had to pick up more food afterwards at another restaurant.  This was very disappointing.

uW7VuluiWB1hnkCgVMLl0A.text: Freshest and highest quality sushi in town! Delicious food and great service. My husband and I go often and we're always satisfied.

eMA8ioq9tC3D9AjqeS_MQQ.text: I enjoyed the spot during Restaurant week.  The atmosphere is nice.  I sat upstairs at a high top near the bar.  The waiter was great.    Now to the food...The Brussels sprouts were amazing.  I could eat those every week.  The Jidori chicken breast was tender and I loved the sweet potato. And I demolished the green tea creme brulee.  I will be back again.

It is on the pricey side but you can see it on their quality and presentation.  They also make great desserts, everything house made supposedly.  Recommend for date nights, company dinners and birthday.

e1vI1eXav1Chj3ycH7AzCw.text: Easily five stars if air conditioning was better.  Kenny was a pleasure, and great knowledge of the menu.  Food was impressive to say the least. Great sushi, amazing apps.  Small portions and far from inexpensive, but great food and service.  However, this was lost trying to eat in an 80 degree dining room.  Seriously, with a $75  per person check average, fix your A/C.

1K8kpsT0huhRAV13J38TzA.text: Enjoyed Baku for restaurant week. Went on a Friday night and was seated early for my reservations.  We all got different items for each course which were served as they were ready, and we all shared so we got to try many things. It was delicious!  Service was great - got drinks quickly and food came out at a good pace. My only complaint was that the dessert course was an extra $5. Not a big deal except that wasn't clear on the restaurant week website. Will go back for the regular menu.

Kw5xUqHjZ1UXrZgSPYE9Cg.text: I don't even understand how they have a four star rating on here- it has to be from family and friends. We went here for the first time for my husbands birthday because he has been wanting to try it...what a waste! So to start with, the portions were small since you're supposed to share, but the prices were that of a nice restaurant's normal portions. That would have been alright if the food was good, but it was such a let down. Dish after dish was a disappointment. We got desperate and ordered some sushi rolls and even those were eh. Everything was just bland, and the price made it worse. There are just too many amazing restaurants in Charlotte to even bother coming back here- we will not be returning. I will add that the staff was very nice and friendly, though.

0_nMFZruwz-qobaaid0Mkg.text: Great restaurant. One of the best if not the best I. Charlotte. I've been three times and each time was memorable. There was a lot of hype about this restaurant and it has lived up to it. So many others are disappointing but I'm a big fan of Baku Keep up the good work.

Z-O-EDt8gUZ0oCKtnqm14A.text: The food here is excellent! We have been here many times and usually had great service. The only reason I am giving it 3 stars is because of our recent visit. First, I called to verify my reservation 2 days before to make sure we would be sitting upstairs and they assured me we would. This was going to be my friends first time there, so I wanted them to experience the lounge upstairs. Well, when we arrived, they had a table downstairs for us. So, I kindly reminded the hostess of our reservation for upstairs and she told me there was no more tables up there but she would go check. Well, she came back and said there was a lounge table with some chairs, so we took it. I am not picky, and I love the atmosphere of the lounge area, so I didn't mind. Well, after sitting down and waiting awhile, the bartender came up and asked what we wanted to drink. When we asked questions about drinks, he didn't seem to know the answer and wasn't friendly about it. He barely talked to us-only to take our order. I get it, maybe he was having a bad night. But, to take it out on us, especially a repeat customer and 4 potential new ones-not smart for business! I never received one of my sushi rolls and told him about it but he still charged us for it and made it seem like we were lying. Now, I am sorry, but for as much money we spent, I sure as heck wasn't trying to get a free sushi roll!! I am not trying to knock this place down, but just wanted to share this incident because it was embarrassing to me, after telling my friends how great the place was and service has been and to have this happen was a big let down.

eIa3LygkD4tpoFv8nCP1GQ.text: Baku is worth every penny! My husband and I have been several times. The tuna tartar and scallops are delicious!!! We also loved the duck and cod. The only dish I would not recommend is the rock shrimp. It tasted like your basic fried shrimp, rather plain.  If I could eat here every weekend I would.

3krnEKISgHhi-VrzcGF8Dg.text: Great spot in Charlotte!! I live in LA but am in Charlotte about 3 times per year and this is the best thing you guys have going!! I have had robata at Katana on Sunset Blvd. in Hollywood and at Wolgang Puck's Robata restaurant in Vegas but this place tops them both! Very delicious and creative menu!! I will make Baku a regular stop when I come back to town!

e7alhXJfCgdI1h43wRa17g.text: Food was good, but WAY over-priced for quality and amount. The majority of the items we ordered were pretty good. The sushi (maki rolls) on the other hand lacked variety and flavor. Wish there were more options on that menu. I did like the nigri and it was very fresh. I would only recommend this place for special occasions as the price point is so steep.

OUJvOcHHTjlKC7dGJRntOg.text: One of the best places in town. Food is awesome! Try the lamb, best lamb I've had. And that tomahawk 40oz steak is out of this world. Great date place, it's a must-visit place in charlotte

J9hdO4J4vYE4mXzNdb981g.text: Great food, but unfortunately we had terrible server experience.  Not impressed if I'm willing to pay that much.  Will not return.

JrWoekSneM6QmJ7IwJM7xw.text: Food here is good but definitely (seriously) over priced. The environment is nice but for less than 2/3 of the price here you can get same quality sushi/Japanese fusion dishes at Cowfish, Yama sushi, and Musashi  in Charlotte.

JLuym0J_-WmLMRFou1Aqkg.text: On the surface I was expecting just expensive sushi but Baku brought is so much more. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Creative and flavorful menu. As soon as my wallet recovers, which I don't begrudge them I will be back in a heartbeat. Expensive is fine if they can deliver and Baku did in every way.

VBdtyChR1lBXug9jLxZNdQ.text: Had brunch here today, the food was amazing! The meal was a preset menu. It was good. I'll be back soon. For sure.

jxT-itVMKsfNs_Z120KF1g.text: Great service & Excellent food.   love trying the new specials they have every week.   The live uni is a treat.

pBbPJcccCho5-PNZBkH-tg.text: The best sushi in Charlotte. Chef Mark is the best! You must try this restaurant if you are a sushi lover!!

RWfSdE-KOF5OefoLAy1zyw.text: This is my first time to Baku in Charlotte South park area and i was invited by my friends for a private party. I have to mention that the decoration and atmosphere of the restaurant was amazing in being an exquisite authentic Japanese restaurant. They have an appetizer set which was uniquely mixed yet the items compliment each other. The Sushi is REALLY fresh, and the homemade desert is absolutely delicious. It is an amazing experience. The staffs were very welcoming, view is amazing, food is delicious, pleasant atmosphere. I will definitely be back.

9Xz_CWpgVwKja58uLQemug.text: I have to say that the flavors of the food were excellent. However, the amount of food that you get for the price you pay is ridiculously under expectation. Example: Ice Bowls for "2" is $20.00. This means that each person at your party of "2" get 1 piece of sushi, for $20.00. I found it to be ridiculously over priced for what we received. Dessert Bowl: $40.00 for what appeared to be Sara Lee desserts and 3 scoop of ice creams. The atmosphere was good and the A/C was broken or off (90 that night), service was very slow. This was not the servers fault, understaffed was the issue. Again the flavors are excellent atmosphere was good. However for me to return they are going to need a major improvement on the A/C and upgrade the portion size. Total price or our meal with 20% gratuity was over $400.00 for a party of 4. This was with moderate items ordered.

o-qagd2nDHUS9DUO3g6onA.text: Went to Baku for my wife's birthday dinner while we were visiting Charlotte. We each had the Omakase Chef's Tasting and it was amazing! It was two hours of a culinary delight. Our server Amber explained everything and helped make this evening a truly wonderful time. A very memorable meal.

fFXttRr5zcRELUmfS6VyDA.text: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday dinner on a Friday night and we had such a great experience. Our server was very knowledgeable and attentive. Neither myself nor my boyfriend knew what sake to get since they have such an extensive list and our server listened to what we liked and brought out a great selection. Additionally, we had no clue what food to get, and our server again took the time to figure out what we liked to eat and made some recommendations that were right on point. I had the chicken entree and it was delicious. Will definitely go back.

02imZ2z7ZQ810unSHcEzJQ.text: Baku is one of our favorite restaurants in Charlotte.  Is it expensive?  Yes, but well worth it.  Unique dishes for the Charlotte region and a great atmosphere.  If you're wanting the most food for your buck, then this isn't the place for you.  Baku's dishes are about quality, not quantity.   If getting stuffed is your thing, try Cowfish across the street.

Z5WADKgLjhwrHhykAIjurQ.text: Ba-Who I say Ba-Who and the answer is Baku which is a MUST DO.. Corny Huh well I'm so high off good eating that I came up with this chant. This place is AMAZING. The food, The Service, The Ambiance, The people (Staff & Customers).. A to Zinc My girlfriend invited me out to check this place out for a late Birthday outing ( my bday was in August) and I informed her that I had this place bookmarked to try and she ensured me that I would not be disappointed. We sat upstairs in the savvy bar area at the actual bar, the bartender was amazing we talked about everything under the sun including the drinks in which I had a Gin Martini with cucumbers which we so refreshing and tasty.  Chef Vince came up and spoke with us and ask what we did and did not like and he would come up with some platters for us and bring them up personally or send them up via a waitress. SCORE  We started with Tore Tar Tare with a quail egg and rice crispy treats on the side (not your snap crackle and pop over sweeten treat, but instead a steady consistent tasty compliment to the Tare Tare). The quail egg to mix with the Toro Tar Tare was AMAZING it switch up the texture and flavor as I ate a couple scoops prior to adding the quail egg and once it was added OOOOO MMMMM Goodness. Next up came the edamame which we had tossed in spicy sweet sauce which was DE-LIC, next up was Grouper Tempura Yes I said GROUPER TEMPURA. There was a method to eating this as it  was suggested by the server to sprinkle some of the crushed salt provided first then add some ginger she finally some of the dipping sauce that was a perfect method and it was OOO so GOOD. We also had a chef Vince creation sushi roll which I'm sure had salmon. For dessert the chef created a fleet of desserts from Mango cake to 5 Flavors of sorbets to fresh fruits ALL were YUMMY.. I can't wait to have DATENIGHT with my husband here as it was an amazing experience and one of my Top5 in Charlotte for sure easily.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Special dessert platter made by Chef for my Birthday (late Birthday gift to ME)
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Edamame HEAVEN tossed in spicy sauce GOODNESS. YUM
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. GROUPER Tempura YES I said GROUPER

jF8W48FXcS85gSOH6nqAxA.text: Easily my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I am dumbfounded by some of these negative reviews. The cocktails are always delicious and the food is insane.  Baku is the best special occasion/ fancy pants dinner spot in town. We've dined downstairs with friends and family -- and found cozy spots upstairs by the bar for a more intimate feel. In my experience, it's best to go with a few people who are down to share, drink, and hang out. On nights that we dine here, Baku is the main event and we've never been disappointed.  Our favorites include: Salmon belly nigiri (the best food ever), Spicy hamachi rice crispy treat, chicken wings (yes, I'm serious), Toro Tar Tare (pricey, but worth it), all of the prawns, wagyu filet, and the black cod. The desserts are pretty good and completely beautiful, but you probably aren't doing Baku right if you still have room for dessert at the end of the meal... just sayin.

SJDJ-Kapyr05k5Nof8GBmg.text: Well. I will say firstly this was a very unique visit.  It was the second most worst place I've ever visited. Why?   The food was brought out in all different orders and I was eating alone while my wife and others were watching me. They claimed it was because everyone ordered what we did. But the problem with this was every course was the same way.  And to kick this, everything was cold! Had to send it back and even the people serving had no clue where to bring things. They also didn't even tell us what things were. Thank god I was not allergic to tuna or id be in the hospital or worse dead!  Management needs to get fixed here. Before id ever go back again.  The manager attempted to make this "better", he wants to give us desert. The desert menu was out of date supposedly and they don't have hot tea. More so, they don't have hot green tea in a Japanese restaurant!  Be warned stay away!

k_c2HVy9HkpR9zlSr4eKag.text: We made reservations an hour before we arrived on a Saturday night and had to wait a few minutes for our table, which was fine because we was able to check out other parts of the restaurant. Giving this restaurant 3.5 stars because of the pricing in comparison to portion size.  The food here was delicious and the atmosphere was lively. Our service started out a bit slow, but it gradually got better after we had ordered our small plates. The items came out as they were done, which was perfect because we were able to enjoy and savor each dish separately.    As a caution, this restaurant is very pricy so if you come here be ready for a big bill. We had 4 cocktails and shared 7 small plates/sushi rolls and our total came to $260.   Also, the valet is complimentary too.

lxJvWDUPCCaScSjGYnJlpA.text: We went to Baku for their brunch buffet today and I would NOT recommend their brunch to anyone.  We paid $36 a person and we were very disappointed with their food selection.  According to their brunch menu, they make you think you getting sashimi and nigiri part of their Buffet but instead we were told is $2 a piece if we would like to order their sashimi/nigiri.  If you read their brunch menu carefully, there is NO WHERE in the menu mention is a up charge.  Don't waste your money on their Sunday brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. No where in this menu mention there is a up charge for their sashimi/nigiri!
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Horrible Sunday brunch! Not worth your money! Don&#39;t waste your time and money!

wMBRV8boOP2c_4e05wjt6Q.text: Ate here on a Saturday night and the ambience inside the restaurant was exciting with the cooks grilling the meats on the right side when you first enter. We sat on the second floor which was quieter than downstairs. We ordered 3 sushi tapas and 3 meat tapas with prices ranging from $7-$30. We got the Rainbow bowl, salmon belly nigiri, spicy hamachi crispy rice roll, wagyu tartar, robata chicken livers and robata pork belly.   The sushi dishes were delicious! Fresh fish and beautiful presentation. The wagyu tartar was over seasoned and was way too salty for our taste. If you have a great piece of wagyu why kill it with all that seasonings?? The robata chicken liver was undercooked and pork belly over cooked. I would come back for the sushi but not robata.
