D9HMcSqZjyc3OhaqwNrEZw.text: We make reservations for my birthday party on a Thursday night at Baku. It was really calm on the first floor and I guess it's where older people like to hangout, so we decided to go to the second floor.   We had 2 different rolls, oisters, salmon and a fillet minion and some drinks. Nothing impressive about the food, it was all about small plates very well decor. Our bill was $200+  I did enjoy my birthday, but not enough to come back for dinner.

anT3ymzUtud79jnKzJmNQA.text: I really enjoyed the various tapas here aside from the slow service.  I recommend ordering everything at once or else your dinner could be over two hours just waiting on a simple alcohol beverage or tapas.  It's a great atmosphere but the service is a little slow.  I highly recommend the uni spoon, very flavorful and delicious and it's $10 a spoon.  If you like uni and quail egg it's really worth it.  Also their raw Kumamoto oysters are the best and most expensive oysters I've ever had.

07we87hYwpBynRxNTb59zA.text: Went to visit my son and daughter in law who now live in Charlotte. My son told me this was one of his favorite restaurants. He was right, this place was amazing! The service and the food was top notch. Everything was done to perfection. The restaurant was packed so I'm not the only person who thinks this way!

K0SI8fETCYevbO3fJXuWxQ.text: The food was overpriced! But at least the waitress was really sweet when she asked if we'd be interested in the chef's omakase special...unfortunately we declined at $100 per person!!!

zlTHcFgaS4CqvxQu9J-U7w.text: This was the third dinner at Baku and we really enjoyed all aspects. I love the food here and the drinks are well done. I noticed and it is True that this is an expense be place to eat... We tasted and did not over order and our bill was not outrageous.  I always believed that the last thing you want to be cheap is raw fish :)  We will continue to dine here for special occasions. Sorbets were incredible too.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taste over quantity any day!

zRJrXSH71vru8WJs2P6jZA.text: John W, our server, was absolutely phenomenal. Since the menu was slightly intimidating, John took his time to walk us through the menu, hinting at what we may or may not enjoy according to our unique palates.   We started the night with a decadent cucumber mint martini which was refreshing after just milling about South Park Mall. The Martini was followed up by the crispy calamari. This calamari was paired with a chipotle mayo sauce and a grilled lemon. The kick of lemons acidic juices added an extra layer of flavor atop the delicately fried, perfectly seasoned, squid pieces. I cannot rave enough about the calamari served here. I find that calamari, if not quality squid, is chewy and rubbery. However, at Baku this was not the case-- the calamari was buttery and smooth, it melted in my mouth.   Next up: the seasonal tempura vegetables. Unlike most tempura, the chefs only fried a thin crust around the various veggies, which complemented the vegetables flavors instead of overpowering them. This dish, akin to the calamari was served with a grilled lemon but instead of a mayo based sauce, it was a miso-soy-herb medley. Absolutely stunning.   We continued onto one of the salads, the roasted eggplant and tomato to be exact. This dish was another piece of art. The dish was a mountain of Japanese eggplant cut into small ovals and roasted to perfection. The seedy consistency of the eggplant was paired with crisp heirloom tomatoes that waited at the bottom of the eggplant mountain, acting as sort of a foundation for the plate. I decided to cross-contaminate here and dipped the eggplants into the miso-herb sauce that came with the vegetable tempura.   Lastly was our sushi-- and boy was it worth the wait. We had an order of Gokujo Tuna and Forbidden. Both were presented beautifully. Forbidden was wrapped with black rice, a nice change of pace from the normal sticky sushi rice. The black rice added an extra crunch to the roll. The gokujo tuna roll had a wonderful underlying heat that amped the flavors up a bit. This heat is reminiscent of a wasabi type heat-- one that comes through your nose and mouth then tapers off slowly. Paired with this heat was the yuzu sauce, a citrusy sauce that truly pulls the plate together.   Overall, Baku was phenomenal. I look forward to coming back.

nicwObWi8dQTWDHct-b4bQ.text: Wife pick Baku today to try during restaurant week. The restaurant has a very nice relaxed atmosphere and very clean restrooms. We didn't know this was a tapas restaurant and the portions are, IMO very small compared to other Tapas restaurants. The food was EXCELLENT!! Our server Dave was very attentive and answered any and all questions we had. He also made recommendations on the restaurant week menu and explained the ingredients and how it was made. I recommend eating a snack or something before you go or look forward to digging down close to your knee to pay the bill.

OgRos1gQN40RuJidFn6YAg.text: I had a farewell dinner with my dining buddy, who is moving. Who is going to be game to eat out with me now? *Sigh* Anyhow, Baku was the last hurrah for the time being and it was okay. I arrived later than intended and she was gracious enough to allow me to have her last tiger prawn. These were shrimp sized prawns to say the least and the smallest prawns I've ever eaten. That being said, the sauce that they come in is heavenly and I used it as my condiment for literally Every dish that was served. Want to take great sushi to the next level? Dip it in tiger prawn sauce. Jidori Chicken too bland and far less impressive than a past visit? Dip it in tiger prawn sauce. Brussel sprouts have too many flakes and taste burnt? Dip it in Tiger Prawn sauce. Calamari was great, but you guessed it. I dipped it in tiger prawn sauce as well just because.  Service was excellent. Our waiter was very knowledgable about the menu, and even gave us the background on how each food was prepared. Did you know the 20% over pricing at Baku is because they cook with organic charcoal flown from Japan? I cannot make this stuff up. Major polite smirk. The thought of someone labeling charcoal as organic cracks me up. That's where we are as a society.  I'd give a 3.5 if it was an option. Nevertheless, it is not and I'm rounding down because of the chicken and Brussel's sprouts. I'll be back sooner than later.

aPJtxeXnqgu8TFoNuHCT1w.text: Very trendy and sophisticated restaurant in the heart of Southpark.  I went here for a large birthday dinner with friends. It's located right across the street from Southpark Mall next door to the "ski slope" church.  I will preface this review with the fact that I'm not really into sushi.  My table ordered a special sushi dinner that was multiple courses and was not on the menu.  I didn't try many of the dishes. I will write about what I did try and rate it accordingly.  I ordered the skirt steak based on others reviews on Yelp. Thanks yelpers! It was fantastic! So juicy and tender. I'd go back just for the skirt steak.  The high light of the night was the Wagyu meat! It was amazing.  For $25/oz it better be though. It literally melts in your mouth it is so fantastic.  It was a special treat for the birthday party celebration. Not something I would order myself because of the high price tag.  Every plate that came out was presented beautifully and you could tell the chefs had taken a lot of time to display the food.  I had a great time with my friends but I don't know if I will be back here because of the steep price tag. Maybe I will check them out during restaurant week.   They do have a large bar upstairs and valet parking out front.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wagyu beef melts in your mouth! Amazing but $25 an ounce

bT-5kxClbcY63wuvMtks-A.text: This restaurant was the best place to eat. The service was spot on. Everyone was so respectful and nice. The food was amazingly fantastic and was very filling. Baku is definitely the best restaurant I have been to and I know I will be going back to eat more.

8BNKPVDssOsgbXbkBgY7Ag.text: Definitely get the ice box and the ootoro (fatty tuna) tartare if you are here for sashimi experience. The ice box will allow you to sample a whole range of seafood, including, but not limited to, tuna, fatty tuna, salmon, mackerel, octopus, scallops, etc.  The spicy tuna on crispy rice wasn't too spicy, but it definitely had that delayed heat at the end.  The amazing service and the loungey type of seats upstairs made this whole food experience even better.

9PWjptLEtUfTDbvapTs5Tw.text: The freshness and sheer quality of the sushi & sashimi never ceases to amaze me. It is quite pricey, but it's very well worth it - you get what you pay for. It's about quality, not quantity. Great sake selection as well!

-Pqp4z0IlTgJDmS6jvysxA.text: The bartender upstairs is great - he made a perfectly-sweet-but-strong adult beverage for me.  And the the sushi was delish. It's redeemed itself for me.

oXKylreDqI0fO--Jzmuwzg.text: This is by far the best sushi place I've ever been too! Me and my boyfriend try and come here at least once a week to see Mark. He does an outstanding job of making sushi rolls, sashimi, and anything creative he wants to make for you (like sushi pizza!) My absolute favorite is the crab filled tuna dumpling with caviar. It's the best thing you will ever eat. The service is great, the food is great, the restaurant is clean. Always a great experience!!!

7K147k_U9Xnd0uGoHW1pAw.text: I'm devastated I've lived near SouthPark for 4 years and just came here for the first time. Incredible. Truly one of our top picks in Charlotte! The staff is personable and fun, the food is fantastic and the ambiance was really great. I can't wait to go back!!!! Our favorite was the Pork Belly, but everything was really good!

V9P0N7_T3xthDh6LEzN6ug.text: Oh my gosh. We need to quit our day jobs and work here just to indulge ourselves in the food served here! If this restaurant just served the ginger avocado, fresh corn salad it would have been enough to merit five stars. The whole experience with warm greeting at front door, incredible sushi loving server James, the team who thank you for coming as you leave, merited a ten star! The lobster sushi was incredibly delicious in taste, appearance and texture! My husband inhaled his salmon roll, almost swearing with a full mouth, that it was the best sushi ever. We are very picky sushi eaters, but there was nothing to pick but the scraps on our plates. We share the Duck was untouchable in taste. I did without my entree just to try the homemade key lime and citrus cream pie. My husband doesn't eat desserts but wolfed half of mine!   Spotless restaurant, big smiles, great service, generous portions, reasonable prices and oh so delicious! All this time we had been driving by here on way to Phillips Place for hair cut. So glad we stopped here tonight!

QLPM8bedKjtiMhC3PR6KQw.text: Best sushi in Charlotte!  Salmon belly nigiri is amazing, and the tuna is so rich and melts in your mouth. Had the miso soup as well, which is probably the most authentic I've had. Black cod is also amazing.

ucQfLLCrdFJ0s4YBtt3wqQ.text: Okay. So let me start by saying that I would actually give this place 3.5 stars - pretty good food, great service, small portions and overpriced. But Yelp doesn't give me the option of doing half stars so I'm gonna go with three.   We did girls night here and we each did the restaurant week menu. Now when we sat down, the server said he recommends that everyone get two dishes and it's meant to share. Let me tell you, I'm not sure who is sharing these dishes because the serving size is small. There was a woman next to us who was served her brussel sprouts when I got there. She dramatically said "oh my goodness! It's so much food! I won't be able to finish this!" I looked over to see no more than 7 cut up brussel sprouts on her plate. *insert eye roll here* Let me tell you, my girl friends and I all were easily able to eat every item (and we each ordered three separate dishes/courses - no sharing here).   I started with the brussel sprouts and they were wonderful! They had tons of flavor and the texture was amazing. My next course was the dumplings. I loved the flavor and they were crispy on the outside. I also really liked the green onion and peppers on the side that I tossed into the ponzu sauce. For the third course, I had the salmon and, after squeezing the lemon on it, really liked it.   My friend was still hungry and ordered the chocolate cake and said it tasted like a little Debbie cake and wasn't worth the price.   Had this place been more reasonably priced, I would've definitely given it four stars but give the portion size and price point, I think three stars is reasonable.

lGdk-vjE3s-YzIAN-veAMg.text: This place needs a new manager.   They took us to upstairs when downstairs was pretty empty, which is weird but fine. Upstairs was pretty empty too, only 4 people were using dinner when we got there. Then when we started our entree, there are a 4-people party came, and they were seated right next to us, REALLY?! There are so many other tables out there and they have to seat them right next to us?   When we finished entree, one of our appetizer didn't come, we reminded waitress she told us it would come soon. 10 mins later, we were still waiting and have to listen to our loud neighbor's table(to be fair they are not that loud but 4 people talking right next to you, and you can clearly hear their conversation). So we told waitress we are leaving, we don't want to wait for the dish they forgot to cook. No apologizes from the restaurant.  Waitress said she took the dish off the bill and she made it sound she did us a favor.

Vd6OBVz5hbw0g6KgW7ALzg.text: Another really good dining experience at Baku.  We usually opt for the more casual upstairs bar when seating is available.  Staff is always polite, accommodating, and prompt.  We had about 5 or 6 small plates all of which where well prepared, tasty, and unique.  Great ambiance as well.  If Yelp allowed for 1/2 stars this would be 4.5.

Z3dnDuPk4Vis_LgZdfnDDw.text: Good food - mediocre service. They food and atmosphere are top notch, but I have been here twice and received poor service both times.

fShooLNIL72Mdb0c8H_KRQ.text: My husband and I chose Baku for a weeknight dinner date during Queen's Feast. We've heard great things about the place and definitely were not disappointed.  Atmosphere:  Cool, eclectic vibe. Host, bussers, and waiters were very attentive and personable.   Food Must-Haves:  -Chili-glazed edamame. My mouth waters just typing about it - it was seriously SO good. Do it. -Brussels sprouts were also delicious.  -Potstickers are also a very solid choice. Ours were piping hot and the dipping sauce was very tasty.  -Robata Grilled Atlantic Salmon (entree) was seriously one of the best salmon dishes I've ever had.  -Green Tea Creme Brulee (because it's creme brulee...duh)  So-So items: -Spicy Himachi Rice Krispie Treat (appetizer)... didn't taste like much, and definitely NOT spicy (bummer). Nothing to write home about. -USDA Prime NY Strip... pretty fatty, came out in thin strips. Again, nothing to write home about.   Overall, we'll be back, Restaurant Week or not!

aNhIcoI51OfmXo36WT1y7A.text: 2nd time at Baku over last few months. Each time it was exceptional. Service has been great with very thorough servers on the process and food. Brussels are to die for. Love the Shishmi peppers and pork belly. Ginger salad is a must.  Baku is the only restaurant that excites my 16 yo. She loves the king crab sushi. We'll be back soon!

b7QFCdFuu2ttt-zc0Fn1eg.text: First time going with my fiance and I have to say this might be our new favorite sushi stop. The Wagyu roll is $24 but it was 100% worth the price! Phenomenal. The filet and pork belly skewers were amazing as well. We are already looking forward to returning.

hPIhTrkEcejDkhfDwEZRkA.text: Everything here is amazing. I recommend making reservations if you plan on going. The wine is fairly priced  great date night place

XEM1XJK5PvwqfkvCf2bhYA.text: I been looking  for my favorite sushi place ever since we moved to Charlotte area 8 months ago. By far, this is my favorite sushi place. Smaller portions ( don't expect the usually big rolls from  them) .  They are pretty small but big in flavor.  I recommend it.

bmxUtH3JstwbrME-IAprEg.text: Okay so I know I reviewed this place before and raved about the food, service, etc. But we went back for our anniversary last weekend. Let me say that Baku is probably one of my favorite expensive night out places (and to be honest we thought it was going to be more expensive than it was).   Service was phenomenal!! The hostesses wished us a happy anniversary, our waiter was awesome and surprisingly the same one we had on our first visit, and the management was so thoughtful in giving us a dessert platter on the house for our anniversary. Seriously they were truly amazing and made our evening :)  The food well, we had a combination of things we had tried before and things we didn't try before. The pork belly was to die for!! Seriously I'll never skip that one again lol. Also another new dish we tried was the Hamachi rice crispie treat which was also delicious!! We ordered probably around 8 dishes to share and we were beyond stuffed (needed a doggy bag). However obviously we didn't pass on dessert!!   The cocktails were just as amazing as we remembered... the pear one and the oriental apple are my two favs!! I know a lot of people complain about price versus portions and I can see where they are coming from however we find it completely worth it!! The quality speaks for itself.  Only ehhh item we got was the sweet corn. It was on the cob mini style and it came out cold and had too much oil. It wasn't bad  but we wouldn't order it again.

s87iCjPEZiqy1Ku5oDSCUQ.text: We finally ate here. We had a reservation and it was a beautiful night, so walking in as I realized they have a patio, I hoped to sit there. We were told there was a wait and my husband was hungry so we got seated inside immediately.   I was told wine pours were small, so we both opted for a cocktail. My husband got a gin & cucumber concoction which he thought was kind of like lemonade. I got a wild tea vodka & cucumber drink. It was a little sweeter than I prefer but glad I tried it!  Now to the menu . . . our waitress, Morgan, was very thorough in explaining the style of the restaurant. She suggested an item from each page, but that seemed like a lot. But I guess in the end we probably ordered that much!   We started with the calamari which was delicious! Lightly crispy and delicate! We decided on two sushi rolls. Spicy tuna - yum! - and Forbidden Rice roll which had white asparagus. It was unique and tasty! For our next round, I asked about the baby artichoke skewers which Morgan highly recommended, as well as the rice bowls. My husband wasn't up for either, so we focused on entrees. We ordered Grilled Branzini b/c we'd never had it. It was 2 small slices of grilled fish (not much flavor!!) and a tomato salad. Very small portion and disappointing flavor for $24!! Since our waitress asked about it, my husband told her it was just ok and didn't have a lot of flavor. When she brought the bill, she informed us she took the Branzini off the tab! We greatly appreciated that!  All in all, it was good but not a great experience and not worth the $65 (total without the entree). I'd go back but not anytime soon.

6G9IH4inLvnVfpTUh3s23w.text: Very good.  Something South Park, much less Charlotte, needed.  Good Asian food with nice presentation.

8dRsn1g3YzC0F4O0t4X1YA.text: This is the best sushi I've had in south Charlotte. Been here twice. Very fresh and well prepared. They have great by the bottle wine/sake specials. Posh and trendy atmosphere. It draws all sorts of crowds...I've seen business people by their lonesome eating and working, couples night out, and large group parties. The upstairs lounge is really a great place to unwind and also eat. Parking isn't too bad. Enjoy.

Q07k3CCf6fmhxf1XTHPpnw.text: This is one of our favorite places but honestly after tonight we may never be back. I am all for if servers are busy but the service was terrible, and the excuses were ridiculous. There was one manager that was so sweet but the other manager seemed so disinterested. News flash... We come all the time and were not trying to get free food! We just are not paying that much for food and dealing with incompetence. Sad because after the lack of care or urgency we won't be back. 25 minutes for a beer, wine and a Coke? Really? Wasn't even busy. So disappointed!

I1bRdKPmPlHJsf_CqxK-Dg.text: Once a month my girlfriends and I get together for a long overdue "Girls' Night"!! This month we had the pleasure of trying out Baku, which is centrally located on Sharon Rd. across from South Park Mall.   Un-freaking-believable!!! There was something for everyone, I'm not kidding!! We decided to start with a few sushi and sashimi dishes to share while we discussed wine and sake options with our server, whom I might add was charming, accommodating, friendly, and overall extremely helpful and patient with all of our questions. He picked out a few bottles of sake for our table to share based on listening to our likes and dislikes, delicious!   Next, we decided to continue our experience with some skewers (the pork belly are to die for) and some small bites (2 words: roasted oysters). As new food came, so did new plates, the staff definitely made us feel as if they too, wanted us to have an amazing experience. We tried everything! We ended our meal with surf and turf and vegetable courses, including the spicy filet, lamb chops, duck, Madagascar prawn (you have to see this thing!), black cod, salmon, grilled baby artichokes, and portobello mushrooms.   We were so stuffed after trying so many delicious items, we almost passed on dessert.... J/k!! We decided to share the creme brulee, mango toffee cake, and assorted sorbets. Holy cow!!!!   From the decor and ambiance, to the attentiveness and outstanding service, I know I'll be back and I know we will also be back for more "Girls' Nights" in the near future. This may just be my new favorite restaurant!!

umUi7A09FbiQ9sGtcm1wxg.text: Second night of Queen's Feast: sorry to say, the experience was less than enjoyable. We were seated upstairs. There was a DJ and the volume was uncomfortably load. Three requests to lower the volume all resulted in the same result, we do not have control of the volume. The service bordered on the rude. The portions were disappointing. The wine was good.

ykG4vLEd8TerUC6lNEV4iA.text: I was shocked - SHOCKED - to see butterfish on their menu. I asked our server about it and I said "is that the fish that gives you intestinal issues"? She said "oh no, our chef is world class and he wouldn't have something like that on our menu. Butterfish is escolar." I responded "YES! Escolar is the fish that causes explosive diarrhea!" I then Googled it on my iphone and sure enough I was correct. Why on Earth would they put this on their menu I do not know.   I thought the restaurant was beautifully decorated and very warm and inviting. The service was somewhat knowledgeable and very attentive. However they did the thing that I hate the most and scream "corporate concept" - our server asked if we'd like sparkling or still water and when he asked for still she asked if we'd like Fugi or "Charlotte's Finest". It's a terrible attempt at upselling.   We had the pork belly skewers, blue fin tuna maki roll, king crab leg & salmon roll, tempura veggies, tenderloin and asparagus skewers, pork dumplings, tofu, edamame, etc. We had a wide range of dishes and overall they were all just good, but not exceptional and certainly not memorable. Especially not so for the price.   I'm still shocked that they have escolar on their menu. For that reason, and the lack of a wow factor, I won't be rushing back.

s8Nhqj-p620RBZ1QI-HEbA.text: Good, but overpriced. Not worth the cost considering the quality and quantity per plate. Service wasn't bad, but wasn't great either. Parking also somewhat of a pain in the small lot. This place just isn't worth the time, trouble, or cash.

ntj6MqAI_AQ05iVmgVO05w.text: One of the worst restaurant experiences we've had in Charlotte. We were never asked if we wanted refills on our drinks, and the entrees came out almost 15 minutes apart. Mine was getting cold so I had to eat it, and my wife's didn't arrive until I was almost done. Will not be coming back here. Very disappointing.

9HYN5cDImnJuDAlxhJAX0A.text: Pricey but worth every penny. Our waitress was super knowledgeable and guided us well throughout our ordering. My husband and I enjoyed the whole experience and left satiated and satisfied. We were underwhelmed with the sushi roll we ordered - don't come here for amazing sushi. Come here to try out menu items you can't eat anywhere else. If it looks quirky, order it.

rmGKo-oCl_H2615UUBLyYw.text: My friend and I selected this for her farewell dinner from Charlotte. This is a terrific addition to the South Park culinary scene - the ambiance and decor are warm and welcoming. We ordered the forbidden and spicy gokujo rolls (I preferred the spicy rolls) which were both good. The tofu skewer was crisp and excellent with the chili sauce that accompanied it. The kimchi bowl was a real treat, which I wasn't expecting from a Japanese restaurant. The sorbet dessert was ok. Timing of the food delivery was perfect, and the host was very attentive. Glad I came here (even though it was a hit to the wallet) and would recommend it for a nice evening out with friends.

J3N_S9W1zbnNn06XTtvnfg.text: Baku has great decor and ambiance. Upstairs has a bar and a casual atmosphere. Downstairs is a little more formal. We sat upstairs.   Let's first talk about the service. The wait staff is well trained. They really explain the dishes well and try to sell them to you. The usual stuff like..'oh great selection.. So jealous you are eating it' etc. I liked the service since they try pretty hard.  They have a fair amount of veg dishes which is good since I am vegetarian. The forbidden rice sushi looked amazing and tasted better than any other veg  wrapped sushi I have ever had. The tempura veg was ordinary. The mushroom rice pot was presented and sold to me by the waiter and it tasted quite good. Like a Japanese risotto. The Brussels sprouts were awful!   I was expecting the place to blow my mind based on the menu prices. It didn't . It would have gotten five stars if the food lived up to the price. My significant other ordered meat dishes, she was not that impressed either.

cRHHAPD2kbJkdZX5Vdh6tg.text: I love the ambiance, food was good, but not wonderful. I have had many meals in Charlotte that were much better, for the price.

iSkB_zEEBpP0s5Q0arhF5g.text: This is hands down the best restaurant I've been to in Charlotte. In fact, it might be the best restaurant I've ever been to. It has great aesthetics, great music, phenomenal drinks, and incredible food. The service is on point and all servers are very knowledgable about the menu. I've never been disappointed by this place. Do yourself a favor and take your next date to Baku. (Just don't forget your wallet!)

vlgmyjzyxX80PkCrXR9WAw.text: Had a really interesting experience here tonight - could have been a real disaster, but the restaurant management did exactly the right thing and it made every bit of difference.    Went out for dinner with my daughter - special occasion while she was home for the weekend.  We'd been here once before and really liked it, although it is not cheap.  Tonight, the food was terrific.  We had the pork dumplings, which we were perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned - terrific.  From there we had the lobster and avocado (sushi) roll.  That was okay, but I never tasted any lobster in it.  Went on to the spicy filet mignon with the mushroom pot and rice.  This thing is a madman - spectacularly tasty and just perfect with the beef and mushrooms.  Did the pork belly skewers which were great with some kimchee and some other stuff that was all terrific.  Food was perfectly prepared, service was great!  So now the problem ...  We were seated at a nice table towards the back of the restaurant.  Behind our table, however, was a booth of four guys in their 40s who were doing some serious drinking.  They were loud from the moment we got there, but as time went on, they became more and more animated.  Their language was disgusting - loaded with f-bombs shouted at the top of their lungs.  I was embarrassed for them, but the longer it went on, the angrier I got.  Long story short, we cut dinner short and let our server know that we needed to get the hell out of there.  She was extremely apologetic - knew exactly what was going on - and got us our check quickly.  The manager came over and apologized again.  He also let us know that he had taken about a third of our check off (much appreciated) and he gave us a $25 gift card for another visit.  In short I think Baku handled this situation just about as well as anyone could have hoped.  We appreciated it and we'll be back.

NSHsGbwKur6IiFw4rTPHfA.text: Baku was recommended to us by a bartender at one of our favorite restaurants. There was a high expectation before we even got there... I'm sure you know where I am going with this. The ambience was nothing special, reminded me of the inside of a Pier 1. The service was good, I can't take that away from them, but very robotic.  Every server had a long spiel about the menu, our server actually walked us through the whole menu. We can actually read and naming almost every dish was misleading- he should have only highlighted the best or best selling. The cocktails were nice, Pimm's cup and Cuba Libre.  As the food starting coming out family style things started to go pear shaped. Chicken livers, no, don't do it. Pork dumplings, good, but basic. The sushi was the highlight. We had a signature eel roll with sweet potatoes (off of the specials list). And a salmon belly nigiri with some sort of glaze. Honestly I wish I could name them but I was so distracted by the amount of food that we ordered and did not enjoy. Corn on the cob, was too charred on the grill for my liking. The robata duck with melon was good, and a generous portion. Butterfish sashimi was another fail for us.  Did I mention the fruit flies that swarmed around us the entire time?  When I got the check it was insult to injury. $$$ should be more like $$$$. I was still hungry!

tuGSb4CBZKGkES-76zlZoA.text: This place is off the hook good. Probably the best asian place in town. The food is more meat based opposed to sushi based and everything I have ordered from here (normally 6-9 small plates each time) is really good.  It isnt cheap, but it is worth it. We go maybe once a month, but would go more if we could.

JXp_9iiAwlomYci2yL_zgQ.text: I've heard/seen so many mixed reviews about this place I just had to give this place a try myself. Personally my husband and I had a great experience. The service was great and the food was pleasant. We had the calamari (which by far has been the best we've ever had), smoked salmon nigiri, soft shell crab roll and the 55 oz Australian tomahawk steak. We kinda knew what we wanted before hand which I think that is what made our service go pretty well. Our server had no problem with bringing our food out on time. There are a few things I didn't like which was the music (a little to loud), and the plain rice we ordered was really mushy and tasted like water the texture was horrible the kimchi was very salty as well. All in all this place is very nice and I do consider coming back soon

S_K8_Gt7RXnb6Z94-q9Taw.text: I read other reviews and had high hopes for Baku since sushi is one of my favs.  I was reallly disappointed.  We got there at 6pm on a Friday night.  Being across from the mall you would have expected this place to be packed. Maybe that should have been my sign.  There were only 3 customers.  A lady at the bar, me, and my honey.  We were seated and it took 5 mins before the waiter came over.  The server was nice enough.  The only thing more plentiful than customers were nats!  We kept having to swat our food and drinks.  Geez. We ordered 2 miso soups(red and traditional ) and 2 apps(baked oysters and seared tuna). My honey usually has no strong reactions to food but we agreed...horrible. Oysters fishy and not fresh - i almost resorted to spitting the one I ate in my napkin.  Seared tuna was absolutely tasteless. The soups were ok. We decided to leave after a disappointing start and fighting nats in hopes of salvaging our night out.  Maybe it was just an off night for Baku- but bad enough for me to have no desire to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Empty on Friday night...

UqMCcLnu9bi4GtalAfr8xw.text: I had very high expectations for an authentic and original concept to come to Charlotte and shake up the food scene in the South Park area. My expectation's were met with much disappointment. While everything was not terribly horrible, the restaurant was an oddity, the atmosphere felt confused and awkward, and the service was-HORRIBLE.  We were greeted by the general manager opening the door, which was nice, but the hostess sat us at a horrible table, when there was literally no one else in the restaurant. With multiple seating options it felt a little ridiculous to be sitting at the first tiny two top against a wall-which just felt unwelcoming. With booths available you think you would want to make your guests comfortable.   The server was the master of up-selling, he brought us out a $6 bottle of Fiji water-and without even presenting it he opened it up and proceeded to poor. Where is the tap water, the other tables had it? He asked if we wanted sparkling water or still water-thought this was synonymous with tap water??He also insisted on "guiding" us through the "dinner experience"-like I cant order and read for myself. After an odd monologue about Baku-he moved us across the dining room so we would be more "comfortable." That was kind of awkward but I was glad to have a better table.   Food- The calamari was amazing. The calamari was tender, served hot and fresh, with the perfect amount of seasoning, it came with sliced green chillis that added a nice kick of flavor. A little oily but this didn't distract me from enjoying it. 10/10  It went downhill from there-  Scallops with foi gras- Ok, they were amazing as well, but we waited 15 minutes between finishing the calamari and receiving the scallop. I say scallop because it was one scallop cut in half- you think you'd receive more for 19 dollars? It had a nice flavor but the foi gras was not substantial and by the time it got to the table it had melted away, also hard to cut with chopsticks. 6/10  Chicken Skewers with leeks- Ok- came out hot, had a nice smoky flavor from the grill-right amount of sauce, but where were the leeks? It looked like green scallions were substituted for leeks, and this didn't lend the same amount of  appeal and flavor you would experience with actual leeks. 4/10  Duck breast Entree- Nicely rendered piece of duck, cooked properly, it had a smoky flavor and it was nicely done. It lacked seasoning and a sauce. It came with a small dish of chopped plum chunks-which added a nice sweetness but lacked the body of a sauce and didn't adhere to the duck because it was hard and awkward to eat with chopsticks.. This could have been an amazing dish if it had been served with a sauce and hadn't been so difficult to eat. 7/10  -May I mention that our server suggested we order a vegetable to "cleanse our palet."  So I assume this means before the meat course/main entree? We literally waited for 20 minutes after we finished the duck entree for corn on the cob. By this point the meal had ended- and waiting 20 minutes for corn felt silly. Also no one came by our table to ask if we were ok- the server literally disappeared  When he brought it out he had the audacity to say it eats like desert- by that point we just wanted a check and a box for the corn.   Overall-Weird experience. The music was horrible as well-felt like I was at a graduation party. The ambiance felt confused and unestablished.Food was good, but the courses were improperly timed, dishes could have used a little bit of seasoning or at least the server should offer salt and pepper. Service was non-exsistant for most of the experience, the server was nice and "attentive" at first but after he took our orders he spent most of his time doing side work making us feel abandoned and awkward- the restaurant was pretty much empty- you think you'd be a little more attentive. The service and experience could have been better-especially since the South Park area has a decent amount of competition for a new restaurant. They need to step it up if they want to survive.   Wouldnt go back. Overall- 5-10  Not worth the price :(

0dbDKF1bbCxg1TYWBQAyKA.text: Simply amazing - great option if you are looking for inventive, interesting Japanese options.  We went there on a random weeknight after doing some shopping. Located in an older building across from the South Park mall, the overall impression inside is intimate and sophisticated. Great for a date night or going out with friends after work.  We order a cross section of small plates, including sushi as well as their specialty, grilled meats. Everything was spectacular, from the delicately assembled sushi (including an incredible butterfish with a citrus glaze) to the high-heat grilled items, in particular the scallops and the beef tenderloin. On a related note, if you are a chicken liver fan, you must get their skewered livers, probably the best I've ever had! The ingredients are all top-notch and the subtle flavor combinations are genuinely unique.   Service was very good - intelligent, well-timed and not pushy.  This place belongs on your top-5 Charlotte list!

G53IrJ-74Qr63P7tc2QwCA.text: A very rare 5 STAR review from myself goes to Baku.  Located right on Sharon road near Diamonds Direct - Baku is very easy to find.  We were here last Thursday night at the suggestion of other yelpers - Thanks guys!!!  They had valet parking right out front in case you didn't want to try to hunt down a spot.  There is an upstairs and a downstairs where you can be seated.  Downstairs has the excitement of the open kitchen and very nice decor.  Upstairs is a little sexier with a bar, lounge areas, high tops and low tables.  We were told to get a few small plates so we ended up with the pork dumplings (seared slightly on the bottom - comes with the house sauce - DIVINE), the peppers (I can't remember the name?!?!), tenderloin and asparagus skewers, pork belly skewers, and shrimp tempura.  Each dish was delectable, not too smoky.  Just the right amount of food for two people.  The wait staff was super attentive (although struggling with the restaurant's newness still....)  The decor and music - so sexy chic.  The hot towel service was a great touch.  I can't wait to go back and try new items.  Superb experience and truly a unique Charlotte dining experience.

8Q2nJ4pU8YVIefodYSgwVg.text: Kitchen service and management alone should keep you far away from paying $32.00 for a piece of Cod a la carte. The food is good but good is not enough for this type of restaurant and menu. We ordered multiple appetizers to share along with 3 separate entrees and side dishes. We were a table of 3, ordered our drinks and only one arrived with the excuse of, "the bar is backed up." There were very few tables filled since it was early, clearly the bar was not overflowing. Our appetizers came out one by one in a timely fashion.  First to the table was one of the side dishes to our entrees, sweet potatoes. They say there for 10 minutes before an entree arrived. We of course sent them back. Then came one entree, black Cod, $32.00 a la carte. 10 minutes later the second Black Cod arrived, our third person was still sitting with nothing. We finally asked for the manager. We got a a ridiculous excuse of, "this is a tapas style restaurant your waiter should've explained that to you. I said he didn't have to we've eaten here multiple times before and since we dine all over the country and Europe we can read a menu. It is clearly separated appetizers/entrees/side dishes. In the mean time, while he is arguing his point, our two of three entrees (no side dishes) are still sitting on the table for over 20 minutes.  The ending is our server at least gave us enough respect to acknowledge that our food was poorly timed by the kitchen and they were having problems with service. This alone was the only redeeming quality of ruining my son's birthday dinner. We will NOT be back again.

nmE66LFpM53mE29bUoVvxQ.text: I've gone there twice in the last 2 months.   First, let me say that the food you get is masterfully prepared by the chef. The flavors and options are generally top notch. Presentation is huge, here, and I think that is a lot of what you pay for.   Our experience was marred by two unfortunate happenings:   1)  I got shot down 4 times when asking for drinks. Notably, on 2 different sakes that were on the menu or on display at the bar. This isn't a big huge deal, as I understand that they want to craft an experience... but I'm used to "point and get" at a restaurant.  2) There is a serious problem with their oyster supply system. Each time i have gone I've been served inedible oysters. The first time I ate four and one was horrifying, the second time I ate three and I had to spit out one, and another I swallowed but was not acceptable.  Also, the water tasted like crap (which I wonder about whether this is related to some of the other small problems).   All in all, it's outstanding food preparation that is crippled by fundamentals. There is a lot of potential in this restaurant if they can fix some of this stuff.

b2grpgpRsR7I9G3Mruf16A.text: Wow, thought I had already reviewed this place but apparently not.  Well for starters you have to love the interiors.  As stated in some of the other reviews, the upstairs area is preferred if you are looking to lounge.  I loved the ambiance of the place.    We came on their first official night open so there were some kinks in the armor, mostly relative to bar menu and drink selection but the service was friendly and prompt none the less.  The food was fantastic, the pork belly melts in your mouth and the shrimp tempura was divine.  The peppers we had were incredible and although considered a small plate, I found the portions to be fairly large enough for two.

yLS6V1yDVpS8ftb7bFbw0Q.text: Food was delicious, service impeccable, atmosphere was amazing!  I will definitely be back!  The pork dumplings were tender and flavorful and the rock shrimp tempura were perfectly seasoned and piping hot when the arrived at our table- the perfect way to start our meal. Next we tried the butterfish which was unlike anything I've ever tasted- the butterfish, white asparagus and sauce came together and were nothing short of magic. The spicy filet of beef was cooked perfectly and so tender that I was easily able to eat it with my chop sticks, and the sauce was heavenly. Then we enjoyed the largest king crab leg I have ever seen, with sweet local corn and baby artichokes.  Please do not leave this restaurant without having dessert, we tried the dark chocolate espresso truffles with sour cherry sauce and cinnamon/ginger snap ice cream-  i could eat that dessert everyday for the rest of my life and never tire of it.  Long story short it was the type of dining experience that makes you want to call all of your friends and demand that they to go experience the wonder that is Baku! I promise you will not regret it.

yk_bLqcZvVaJseoKjiwkYA.text: Date night and we love sushi! To start off....the food was DELICIOUS! Each item we ordered was more delicious than the last! That being said, I cannot understand the low quality of service. Each server seemed to have a sense of arrogance. A different server brought us the wrong plate and when we asked him about the one we were supposed to have, he responded with "how would I know, I'm not your server, but I will go ask him." We sat at the sushi bar and went through most of the meal without ever speaking to a server again?? We poured our own wine all night, and sat with empty plates for 15 minutes before we asked for our check. Our server apologized for the lack of service and hospitality and offered to buy us a drink at the lounge upstairs & the bartender did take great care of us. I would have given Baku 4 or 5 stars but the lack of service brought it down. The restaurant would be great with just an improvement in service and hospitality.

47QsY3e6C8D2npHeEL6kUA.text: We had an outstanding dinner last night. The food, service and ambiance was fantastic. Highly recommend this restaurant!!

Ccyx0X5szBGQ-fB2D0HFfg.text: Atmosphere was lovely and food was delicious, but be sure to bring your wallet!

uP-9QXVNxOLpTwhiCHS0VA.text: It's my first time visiting Charlotte. My boyfriend and few his friends took me to Baku. The foods are outstanding!!! I went to Morimoto in Philadelphia a month ago. I think the foods here are comparable to Morimoto. We ordered a lot dishes to try. My favorites were Sea scallops with foie gras,and wagyu beef. My boyfriend liked the duck breast, and salmon belly. I would like to come back again.

ufaPn5WoRlnWJXgW5lVPXQ.text: Phenomenal service and food. The pork belly is to die for and the wine list is impeccable! A must visit in the South Park area!

rO4JmtL5AN6_10AcX4RlDA.text: I went to Baku and enjoyed everything about my experience. There were three people total in my party and we shared six dishes. We tried the salmon belly sashimi, the calamari, the forbidden roll, the softshell crab roll, the seared blue fin tuna and vegetable tempura. The salmon belly sashimi was the best! The forbidden roll also had amazing flavors and the other dishes were extremely enjoyable. I would come back here over and over again to try out the dishes!

Nuzjf_bTid-UM3G1ltBA5g.text: I was there the first weekend it was open; the food was so-so. It was a bit of a turn off when you walked into the front of the restaurant and the management and possible owners were huddled by the front door - not to greet you, but just being tense.  We ordered white and red miso soups, which were handed to us backwards; which was annoying because we had to listen to a 3 minute speech on each food option on the menu. I get it, your a new place in town, but I can read. The beef tenderloin with asparagus was good, as was the Kurobuta pork and sweet onion dumplings.  I can't say the food was any more flavorful than say Cowfish. The front patio was nicely decorated and had a fun atmosphere. I wish they had some music piping through the outdoor seating area.

eT3LZr_MOevg4N7Ndg-cJw.text: Holy crap Charlotte.... Baku is here. We got into the Pre-Grand Opening event last night and it didn't take long at all for us to fall hardcore in love with Charlotte's only Robata Grill. Chef Michael Shortino and chef Anoosh Shariat have introduced Robata style Japanese cooking to the Queen City with the creation of Baku in Southpark and we were on hand to check out their creation. Robata is a style of grill cooking designed centuries ago that burn a specially sourced smokeless charcoal at over 800 degrees and gives its food a faint but distinct smoky flavor.  We haven't been this excited about a restaurant since the first time we checked out Chima in Uptown. The buildings unappealing exterior is is nowhere near as impressive as its interior decor. The menu features items sourced from local Carolina growers, Robata Meats, Seafood and Vegetables, Skewers, Tempura, Maki Rolls, Sushi/Sashimi, and Desserts. We were instructed to order between 3 - 4 plates each and try to sample various things from across the whole menu. We happily obliged and ordered the:  - Kurobuta Pork and Sweet Onion Dumplings - Assorted Fresh Vegetable Tempura with Tentsuyu Dipping Sauce - Sake Glazed Chicken Wings with Lime and Sancho Salt Flake - Marinated Lamb with Korean Chili and Garlic - Spicy Filet of Beef with Black Pepper Sesame Sauce - Beef Tenderloin and Asparagus Skewers - Sweet Potatoes with Honey and Cinnamon - Local Sweet Corn with Shiso Butter - Baby Back Ribs with Star Anise, Cinnamon, Sweet Chili Glaze and Cashews - Espresso Frangelico Truffles on Almond Florentine with Cinnamon Gingersnap Ice Cream and a Sour Cherry Sauce with Fresh Blackberries.  As a personal challenge to myself I decided I was going to eat everything we ordered with the chopsticks that were provided or my fingers when appropriate... that means absolutely no spoons, forks, or knives. Everything we ate fell in a range between simply delicious to truly mind blowing. The Kurobuta Pork and Sweet Onion Dumplings were soft, juicy, and an easy target for my chopsticks. The Assorted Fresh Vegetable Tempura with Tentsuyu Dipping Sauce was delicious, crunchy (especially the eggplant), and once again an easy target for my chopsticks. The Sake Glazed Chicken Wings with Lime and Sancho Salt Flake were the juiciest pieces of chicken I had ever sank my teeth into, they had a very faint grill flavor from the robata grill, and were an easy target for eating with my fingers. The Marinated Lamb with Korean Chili and Garlic was juicy and with its giant bone was easy to eat with my fingers.  The Spicy Filet of Beef with Black Pepper Sesame Sauce was the real robata star of the night. The beef was both tender and addictive, and gone in seconds via my chopsticks. The Beef Tenderloin and Asparagus Skewers were an unexpected surprise (we didn't order them) and we decided to eat them up before anyone realized the mistake :) The Sweet Potatoes with Honey and Cinnamon were incredibly soft with a faint hint of cinnamon and easy pickings for my chopsticks. My only complaint with the sweet potatoes were that they came with the skin on and when I tried to take a bite of them the skin came completely off and smacked me in the chin :( The Local Sweet Corn with Shiso Butter was crisp, sweet, lightly grilled, and my fingers made easy work of them. The Baby Back Ribs with Star Anise, Cinnamon, Sweet Chili Glaze and Cashews came out a little later than expected but well worth the wait.  For us the best part of the night is always dessert and for our dessert we had the Espresso Frangelico Truffles on Almond Florentine with Cinnamon Gingersnap Ice Cream and a Sour Cherry Sauce with Fresh Blackberries. The presentation was probably the most unique for a dessert we have ever come across. The ice cream was sitting on a block of ice, everything was resting in a bowl of ice, the espresso frangelico truffles were a dark chocolate lovers dream, the almond florentine was incredible, and I really wanted to drink the sour cherry sauce by itself. Dessert really put my chopstick skills to the test but I crushed it. The truffles were easy pickings, the almond florentine went down without a fight, and the ice cream proved to be a little difficult but with a steady hand I made it happen :)  Baku blew us away and is easily one of the best restaurants in Charlotte. The robata style cooking is unique, the menu is diverse, and the desserts are top notch. If you're bored with your normal Friday night restaurant check out Baku at Southpark and make sure you don't leave before getting dessert :)

YFe-6JWfaeI88KfQpHR6CQ.text: Great service, flavorful food.  Perf for groups that are looking to share lots of small plates and have an experience trying interesting foods.  Always get the crispy rice with spicy tuna on top, and the tuna tartare with taro root chips hit da spot.  The king crab legs make you feel like a Kween and the pork dumplings are everything u want in a dumpling.  Love yourself and come here with cash to blow, fun people and a free spirit.  While you're having a good time with ur crew, food will be poppin up at your table as its ready.  Once one dish is chowed down, the next one is on the way.  Keep dat lineup rollin

POOii7xzPNGbJom9wlatqw.text: Excellent sushi--we had the yellowtail tuna. Also enjoyed the pot sticker dumplings, which has the best savory sauce. The cocktail menu is unique so I ordered a manadarin orange vodka with yuzu juice, from a Japanese fruit. The drink was sweet like a Midori sour but comes in a small glass. Great service even though we had to wait for food. I would suggest reservations because the kitchen was backed up that night.

Y_sbl4cG4jjtLPXhRRgu1Q.text: The food here is pretty amazing and the service is just as phenomenal.  Our waitress knew everything about the food and drink menu, and gave great recommendations.  We must have tried at least 6 small plates, none of which disappointed.  If you find yourself there, try the brussel sprouts, I was craving them for weeks after.

LqaojNgz0VR7ImQkmuEjsA.text: I hosted a dinner program here in the private dining room.  I heard ahead of time that the food was great, so we decided to try it.  Although the food was good, the service was terrible and we were extremely disappointed.    The dinner was on a Thursday night, the servers were not attentive and I had to refill drinks and serve food.  When they brought our food, they did not bring serving utensils.  When we went to finalize the bill, we were overcharged for the gratuity--they gave themselves 29% gratuity and didn't even deserve 10%.  It was awful!  They also charged us for several dishes that we didn't even get.    I do not recommend this venue for private dining functions.

88SQ8ihrr9qJoKTcB-EyFg.text: First time at Baku & it was delicious! Started with the Edamame & Calamari then split 3 rolls with the rest of my party! Super yummy! My favorite roll was definitely the Korean Spicy Tuna roll! Also love the Manchurian Mule!!

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queen Kappa, Korean Spicy Tuna &amp; Baku Lobster

siaLnLbTxvV8MLMwbJRNlQ.text: Upscale Asian with sushi. This is probably the nicest Asian restaurant I've ever been to, certainly the fanciest and most expensive. Definitely the only place I've ever been to where you can order raw quail egg shooters and saki made from ancient Asian igloos. But it's not cheap. A great place to go for a special occasion or just to try some very cool stuff. Facilities are well appointed and clean. Everything I tasted was very good and presented well. Staff was friendly and service was good. For the money I'd probably go somewhere else. We got three rolls and some edamame with two waters which came out to sixty bucks before tip. So yeah is it good? Yes. Is it worth the money that you spend? Probably not.

CL-itCMUseAhAPmy9mFkpw.text: The sushi was extremely tasty, but not worth the price. I tried the edamame and Kawasaki roll. My husband got the Dragon and Snow Crab rolls. All of them were delicious. The ambiance had a modern Asian fusion feel with funky music in the background. The only issue was that we could hear everything happening upstairs, which was distracting. CZ98uN6ukdrxZAxIgsKwSA.text: Decided to try this place out during restaurant week. My sister-in-law had been here before and loved their tomahawk steak so she was set to get it. ISOGwvAaqad9Eb1DplxCwA.text: Date night dinner. My wife loves sushi. Took a look at some of the reviews and decided to stop in. We reserved on open table so no wait. The service was excellent. We started with the shishito peppers and pork belly starters. The shishito peppers were delicious. I believe I could have made a meal of them alone. Next we had a couple of the specialty rolls and some sashimi. I highly recommend the salmon belly.

bOiFEu5SYjEVW9vAZ5LGyw.text: Micheal was a spectacular server and took great care of us! He was very knowledgeable on the menu and had awesome recommendations. We will definitely be returning sooner than later! Can't wait to come back and try the tomahawk!

v9VLYhnS3GGj45CKTbzkaQ.text: Amazing had a day off here. Saw some reviews came over and wow. Sushi chief was great recommend some things, couple that I have never had and yes they where great. Staff was super nice very attentive great experience will definitely be back when I'm in town.

Ranwpke9R887jEMSPVfprQ.text: Swanky, sophisticated, and stylish.  I've really enjoyed the food each trip here. My most recent visit was for a large birthday dinner. My side of the table ordered a bunch of things to split. Shout out to Yelpers who post pics. We definitely nailed our order because of Yelp photos. The skirt steak and spicy hamachi crispy treat were the two main stars and standouts. Pork belly skewers were also delicious. We also got a couple sushi rolls, fried chicken, rock shrimp tempura, spicy edamame, and shishito peppers. All great. I tried bites of both the spicy filet and the strip, the skirt steak beat both of them.   For a large group, our two servers did a fantastic job. My service is always great. I recommend making a reservation beforehand. Note: half price wine on Mondays.  I will say that Baku is kind of pricey for what it is, but I still come back. Highly recommend making a visit here during Charlotte Restaurant Week (January & July).
