Vo5X_hE9MYixhg6lZ1DUYQ.text: First time here, we have lived in Charlotte for 5 years originally from California.  This was by far the best meal we have had since moving here. We have had sushi all over the country and tonight's meal was as good as it gets. Our server Sam knew the menu and explained it with ease. They were attentive to our needs and made sure we had a great experience.  The food was amazing and the best sake menu I have ever seen. Sarah the manger was welcoming and extremely knowledgeable in all areas, especially sake! We had a great night and cannot wait to return.

jp2Zyf3iUUsuM4rcxG8ebQ.text: Got a 7:15pm reservation on a Saturday night at 5:30pm the same day. There's a reason for that.   When sat down (immediately), waiter came to take drink orders. 4 of the first four beers I ordered on the menu we no longer available. Once drinks ordered, 15+ minutes for them to arrive. In interim, a waiter from another section asked if he could take our drink menu. We never saw it again.   When finally ordering food, very first fish order was "no longer available...should have been taken off menu". Ordered a mixture of sushi, edamame, and entrees. Sushi came out immediately. Edamame took 30 minutes and asking twice. Entrees came out a few minutes later. Second drink order took almost 20 minutes for delivery.   In summary, food is good. Service is awful. Price is much higher than the value delivered. There is a reason you can usually get into this place on a Friday or Saturday. Won't be coming back.

z0nZ4rleCv_1NBjwzSP2xQ.text: Met a group of friends last Saturday to celebrate a 40th birthday party. Good company but... Service was very poor. Examples: rude, curt, spilling water (when he was there to pour water), not picking up plates, not being able to bring our individual rolls and just setting groups of food randomly on the table. Just bad. Food was sub par. Sushi wasn't properly prepared. Maybe a step up from grocery store sushi but not by much. I reached out to the GM via email to explain our disappointment. No response to make any amends. Bottom Line. Dinner for two is going to run you $225 at Baku and the food + service is simply not worth it. Go elsewhere!

53fzpQnj20r83BEsu8dT4w.text: This is a classy delicious experience! We went here on a Friday night to get a fix on our sushi craving and this place absolutely delivered! With the awesome atmosphere to the more importantly delicious sushi I highly recommend this to anyone that is game for some affordable high end sushi!

P20QMF5W7I3wHZUGAH1-SA.text: Restaurant week is always a good time to try new places that are at a higher price point.  Bakus restaurant week menu is $35 plus $5 extra for dessert.  Walking in the ambiance is so perfect.  It's romantic and quiet which makes for a nice evening meal.  We arrived about 10 minutes early and were seated immediately.  I always love when restaurants do that!  We ordered some drinks and then placed our order off of the restaurant week menu.  I got the edamame, pork dumplings, NY strip, and split the chocolate cake and beignets for dessert.  I was a little disappointed that dessert was $5 extra on the restaurant week menu, but both desserts were so good I wanted to lick the plate   Let me say that all of my courses were incredible.  I loved everything!  The portions were enough to fill me up and I ate every last thing on my plate.  The reason I'm giving 4 stars is because the kitchen was very backed up.  It took forever to get each course.  Our waitress was apologetic and kept our drinks full though!

qN_gDoRKvAab5ew76F4lww.text: My husband and I came for the first time and we loved it! The service was friendly and fast. Our server Samantha was fantastic! Great environment too. The food was all fantastic. Everything we tried was great but we especially loved the Hamachi Rice Crispy.

_eOQ6byKK_LpA4_2W1srcA.text: Came here for my dad's birthday dinner and was very interested in trying Baku. I have read several reviews and seen plenty of pictures of this restaurant especially when it first opened but it seemed like the hype died down recently.  I made reservations last minute in fear it might be busy on a Friday evening but I had no trouble making reservations on the way to the restaurant. When we arrived I realized I probably did not even need the reservations, there was not a wait and not many people in the restaurant We were immediately taken upstairs to the a dining area. I did like the decor and lounge feel of the restaurant.  Our waiter was very prompt and helpful. Unfortunately he told us that they are in the process of changing the menu so a lot of the menu items are no longer available, ie a lot of the items I saw on Yelp. Because the menu is tapas style we just started ordering everything that sounded good to us.  Pork wontons: these were ok, they were good size and plenty to share among the 3 of us. Brussels sprouts: my favorite item, they were crispy but also a little sweet with a sweet soy sauce drizzled. Pork Belly: good size pork belly but not cooked crispy enough for me, a little too fatty. Dragon Roll: I enjoyed the dragon roll, because my mom is allergic to avocado we had to sub for extra eel which caused them to up-charge us but we all still enjoyed the roll Sea Bass: My dad ordered the sea bass and I did not try it but he said it was ok but which it was cook a little crispier.  Beignets: beignets were not the normal beignets but there were a nice dessert to share after dinner. The ice cream that is on top tasted more of a whipped frosting or something more than ice cream.   Overall Baku is a nice restaurant and the atmosphere makes it a nice place for a low key dinner. I would be interested in seeing the new menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dragon roll
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork Belly

S87779NLkgqVNL-8PBnHOQ.text: Food was delicious but it took over 90 minutes to get it after we ordered. Manager wouldn't shut up and just kept saying "we have acknowledged it but we're training new kitchen staff and no amount of comps will help this". Really? By the way, once we finally finished our meal, we found a couple dead roaches under the table where my friends wife had her bag sitting.

-1WHFmyWz0GBUUwHDgxeMA.text: The first time I came here the food was really impressive. This time around not so much. There were 4 of us that came on a Wednesday night for Queens Feast. The service was non existent. We were told that the whole table had to order off the queens feast menu or all order off the regular menu which I guess makes sense for timing courses. However, our food came out at different times where one person was served their first 2 courses before any of us got any food or someone got their 2nd course before their 1st, etc. I'm very disappointed in the food this time around. It was all bland, something I could've easily made tastier at home. I compared it to pictures from the 1st Queens Feast I went to where we got the exact same order and not only was there no taste but also  no visual appeal. The sushi rolls that we ordered on top of the Queen's feast menu were also meh. The only item I enjoyed on the menu was the spicy hamachi rice crispy treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wagyu ribeye
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork dumplings and I think the tuna roll
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wild king salmon

qs1mdqioDeGrjdLGpoOJGg.text: This place is amazing. We brought our own bottles of wine so I can't speak on their drinks. The appetizers were good and everything was perfect until we ordered a sushi roll and 45 minutes later it still hadn't come.. the first excuse was "the kitchen is busy" but a table that came after us ordered about 10 rolls AFTER US and received their food, ATE IT , and we still didn't have our roll. They never admitted the server either didn't put our order in or she gave it to someone else by accident. Finally an hour later we received our roll (that didn't require rice as it was made with cucumber instead) the food was great but he cautioned by the service

0QMqh7hf71vBVd3oD84TFg.text: Highlights of the meal were pork belly skewers, hamachi rice crispy treat, house made gyoza, salmon belly. Best of all the A5 wagyu was incredible!!!! Sake and wine selections are extensive. Sake advisers and wine sommelier are available to pair your items. Very high quality worth every penny .... will be back. No other place in Charlotte has a variety with items like this. You get what you pay for.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon Belly
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chu Toro Blue fin tuna
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States

xjDll--oOu_lnwof8Yvp9w.text: My coworkers told me how amazing this place was and I could not have been more disappointed. We went during restaurant week and were SO excited but everything from our server, who was clearly on drugs, to the two dishes I sent back ( I can not remember the last time I sent food back, let alone 2 dishes) was frustrating and unsatisfying. We left hungry.  When we asked the server if the calamari was rings or steak, he couldn't even find words to describe it, he showed us his fingers and said it looked like that but in half and round, if you're curious, the calamari was steak. Getting an answer to anything we asked from him was basically impossible because I dont think he could understand what we were saying, he was so strung out.   At the end of the experience, we spent 100 bucks on bad service, a combo of good, mediocre and terrible food and a cautionary tale.  I am giving 2 stars because the calamari and rice crispy treat were pretty good.

AeyIzYEK8Bpw63k6h1SSow.text: I was in Charlotte on business last week and my associate and I were craving sushi. Based on yelp reviews and our proximity to the restaurant, we headed to Baku expecting a good meal.  I have to say, I wasn't expecting a meal this great.  It was fantastic. From the moment we sat down, the experience was wonderful. Our waiter was that perfect blend of knowledgable, funny, and wry. We knew we were in good hands.   The plates are small and meant to be shared, so we ordered three plates (two rolls and dumplings - all amazing), then asked him to bring us two of his favorites - even better!  It really was a perfect evening of food and wine, each course better than the last. I cannot recommend Baku strongly enough. If I lived in Charlotte, it would be tops on my list.   I hope you go. I know you'll enjoy.

TQuqlud9TWMKy143QhCwig.text: Have come back here a few times since my first visit, and haven't been impressed with the food or ambiance. Loud techno with rushed sushi isn't a great combo in my book.  That said, it still has decent sushi just a little on the expensive side.

lIMCFcoeMSaCWdR5sml0KA.text: I've been twice, "they" always say try everything twice!  The first time my boyfriend and I sat upstairs totally different vibe (lounge setting) which we loved. We didn't really order a lot of food, we wanted to have a couple of drinks and eat light, so we ordered the snow crab (maki roll) and rock shrimp tempura appetizer.  The appetizer came out first, and it was very good, but I told the waiter it was suppose to come along with the sushi! It took 45 mins for the one sushi roll to come out, but it was amazingly good when we finally got it! They actually gave us an extra appetizer to make up for the mistake, which was very nice! The second time we went in for dinner, we actually was seated downstairs, but moved upstairs because the vibe is better (our opinion.) We ordered the Chilean Sea Bass, Baku lobster roll, and the snow crab roll again. The Chilean Sea Bass was a small portion, but well worth it because it was amazing, and both of the rolls were as well! I would definitely recommend giving Baku a try, the service, drinks, and food are amazing!

h88ri-JkHulrSZjzhCyZAg.text: Overall, I really enjoyed this restaurant. My SO and I went for the first time during Queen's Feast, and despite the crowd, the service was phenomenal. We were about 30 minutes early for our reservation, which the staff wasn't able to find, so we went to the bar for a drink while we waited for our table. Despite not being able to find our OpenTable reservation for 8:30 and the restaurant being at capacity, the staff handled the situation exceptionally well and we were seated at a table at 8:30 with no problem. Service in the bar was a little slow while we waited for our table, but the bar was standing room only, so that may have contributed to the slow service. There was a live DJ in the bar, which my SO and I really enjoyed. After being moved to our table we had a wonderful server and bar drinks came much faster. We had 6 different dishes, which was a perfect amount for the 2 of us. If we went back, I think 4-5 would be plenty though. While all of the food was good, there were some definite stand outs. The sweet chili edamame was one of my favorites, as were the rice krispy treats. My only complaint was that my salmon was probably closer to medium well than medium, but it was still tasty. My two biggest complaints were that they only had 1 restroom stall for the ladies' room, which created a line at times. And it was unbelievably hot inside the restaurant - this may have been due to the number of people, but other yelpers lead me to believe this might be an ongoing problem. Overall, I was very happy with our experience at Baku and the SO and I would certainly go back! I do strongly recommend making a reservation, as table space is limited and it's a popular spot.

1lwRPfMXeKoQa1nY9j8S8g.text: Came here for my father in law's birthday dinner.  The ambiance was nice and the server was nice.  However, the food was very normal and over priced.  We ordered a lot of small dishes and the sashimi platter for 4 and the big bone in steak.  The sashimi platter was pretty good and the steak with the different kinds of salt was unique. But all in all, the foods were just way over priced for the taste.   Definitely worth giving it a try but was just not enough for us to be returning.

fjd9nQdbgOasQ_gJ_aAfwQ.text: Living in the Southpark area, I had heard from many that Baku was a 'must-go' restaurant. We finally decided to try it out this week for Queen's Feast. I ordered the Hidden Hibiscus cocktail and it was bubbly & refreshing. The music was audible but wasn't too loud that we could not hear ourselves speak. We were unaware that the menu was Japanese 'tapas' style, but our server gave us a long rehearsed speech about the menu and restaurant style.   The Queen's Feast selections were described well on the menu but the portions were rather small. The spicy chili edamame was great, but edamame isn't hard to mess up. I ordered a type of maki roll with yellowtail; it came out in 4 tiny pieces. The tiger prawn & vegetable tempura consisted of 2 skinny tiger prawns, a 1/4 of a mushroom, 2 asparagus stalks and a piece of eggplant. Quite disappointing.   I am glad we went here for the reduced price during Queen's Feast as opposed to paying triple the price on a regular night. I wouldn't rush back here again.

U8bTUVZ_kSBvYXX_nm5KFA.text: We have been here a few times and had excellent experiences every time. Creative menu and presentation. Excellent service. Can get pretty busy so reservations recommended.   I find myself craving their hamachi jalapeno roll. It is my new favorite sushi roll (I tend to like simpler rolls to the fried, zillion-ingredient versions). My son swears that their spicy filet (?) is the best steak he has had next to Ruth's Chris. He orders it every time we go- and eats the whole thing!

rNJjAjTz0VLtnfrNVeBUUA.text: Great atmosphere and music. I chose the scallops and the sweet corn. Very delicious! I will definitely come again to unwind after a busy day.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States

6xGU3TsEt_h4xN6o18i-kA.text: Best dinner spot in Charlotte... By a long run. Small plates are fun and allow you to order a little of everything.  I did not have one dish I didn't like.  The only reason we stopped ordering was because we were full.

A7VKvMWysZxTCu-Salq7lw.text: Terrible experience. Super expensive for what it is and not worth it at all. Please save your money and go elsewhere. I emailed the restaurant numerous times to tell them about my experience and they never contacted me. Terrible customer service.

fJQ8-ZExO1MYPhqaESY74Q.text: Just average. Seems to have gone downhill a little bit the last few times we have been. I really wish a great sushi place would open up in Charlotte, we need one badly!

Hr_VMOn8panhOV-3w2NAAQ.text: I went to Baku to celebrate my son's birthday.  It was fantastic, a True foodie restaurant.  I read the reviews and had a rough idea of what I wanted to order but it was restaurant week and decided to order off that menu.  I saw another reviewer mention John W. we got him too and he expertly helped select the courses.  Calamari was perfect, Hamachi role very good.  We added the pork belly because of the rave reviews; it was great too.   Great atmosphere, great food, expensive but you'll be glad you treated yourself and guests.  I'll be back for sure and looking for John W. again.

hWSIYDinSCEBmMARMivElw.text: Mediocre at best. Management needs some hospitality lessons. Came in at 4 for an early dinner while in the area shopping. Sat in the bar/lounge area upstairs. They were 'open' but still a lot of folks prepping and stuff. If you're gonna open at 4, be ready and set up then or open at 5 instead. Bartender upstairs was super nice and chatty, while he was drinking his coffee. He made some recommendations for me to have for dinner. See them below... While I was sitting there the bar manager (I'm assuming) was taking inventory, while they were 'open'. He was in the bar area for almost 30 minutes while I sat there and didn't even acknowledge my existence or try to make conversation, although he had no trouble joking and talking socially to the bartender...it was pretty sad that someone in a management position at a restaurant missed a chance to make a connection with a customer and make them feel welcome to the establishment instead of being cold. Almost felt like arrogance...anyways, I digress.  On to the food: Pork belly - too much sauce on the cubes but the kimchi and flavors were delish Tiger prawns - decent but just a little tough, maybe over cooked, sauce was good though Brussels sprouts - good Kumomoto oysters - always my fav of the oyster family, but the sauce totally destroyed the usually flavorful oysters (Since the pork belly wasn't 'all that' for me, the nice bartender took them off)  Bottom line, not impressed and I doubt I will revisit the restaurant anytime soon.

Fd2vL3H7D_M-wa2oJWXzyQ.text: 2 stars only because the service was phenomenal and my date was a 10. However we were advised to try the chefs tasting (forgive me I dk what it was called) it was listed on the menu as $100. It was $100 a person which was well over priced and was not specified by the waiter. For $300 we were underwhelmed by charcoal and teriyaki flavored every thing. Go somewhere else in the South Park area. Much better options within one mile.

a2GSMA4sVtzxpTFj3Qm2XA.text: This is a fabulous restaurant in several ways: Food, taste and presentation are impeccable-- Atmosphere, fun, inventive and inviting-- Service, warm but professional.  6 of us ate here last night and did all 'tapas style' dishes.  Every dish was truly exceptional, imaginative and absolutely delicious!  We look forward to returning!

wlQYbo205XDe4vPeyGrwCQ.text: Went again last night.  Another awesome night.  This time we had the pork dumplings, Alaskan king crab, tenderloin with asparagus skewers, salmon nigiri and calamari.  Washed it down with the unfiltered Belvedere martini with a few extra olives... this place is my favorite place in Charlotte.  Everything is excellent.  Food, decor, service... just go here and eat something already.

_5b5_WgSvYjgOcja41FpRQ.text: Baku is outstanding. Have been here 3 times for various business dinners. This is a very interesting robata grill restaurant. The atmosphere is quite casual, but elegant. The menu selections are simply fantastic. All appetizers, entrees etc are great quality and unique. The sushi is terrific. I recommend ordering sushi first for a group, then mix and match a selection of main courses to share across the table. Wine selections are very good. Love this place and will definitely keep going back when in Charlotte.

g_xorEqmi0chFWO_BtaPqg.text: Lovely new little spot! Went here for restaurant week and it was refreshing to know they didn't over book.  Downstairs and upstairs seating, bar on both levels. Our party was upstairs and I was able to get a small drink prior,  House sangria. It was average. They said they added Sprite normally to the drink,  which to wasn't the best idea.   Food overall was really good. Small plates, but all 3 courses were delicious.  For apps,  I had Pork Belly, main course, steak with Wasabi sauce, and dessert, Creme Brule.  Each course was better than the last and surprisingly filling.   A bonus to me is that it's smack dab in the center of 2 bank locations in Southpark. So weekend dining, you always have a parking spot. Not really much congestion.   Only con, I could give is that I wish there were bigger plates with more food!

7oWKvNCkDbYa29VF42rH4w.text: My husband and I came here last night for a 8:15 reservation for Charlotte Restaurant Week. Just to start off, I would give the food 5 stars, atmosphere 3 stars, and service 5 stars.   We were seated immediately upstairs (right beside a group of stupid loud drunk business men. I mean holy bejesus, i dont know what these guys were drinking but I want one of those!....my husband actually moved around and sat beside me on the couch so I could hear him. This actually worked out better cause we enjoyed our meal chatting and sitting right next to each other cuddling on a comfy couch. I recommend it!) and the waiter came over to do a walk through of the menu and "how they do things". This place is True tapas style through and through and I think to enjoy the experience, you have to know that coming in. They bring dishes out as they are ready and it's more of a food experience then meal. (Aka, great for a date like us but probably not the easist for a a group of people trying to just grab dinner). The one thing that irked me some was that he asked if we wanted sparkling or bottled water. Luckily my husband caught of an just requested tap so we werent charged a crap ton for agua. I mean, come on, tap is literally the same thing as bottled and I didnt like that the waiter was kinda deceiving people by only offering those two options. Anyways, I digress.   We ordered a bottle of J Lohr Petit Sirah, which was absolutely amazing! We have actually been to that winery in California and can attest that the bottle price was marked up a fair bit though. Oh well, what can you do about it.   We decided to do the Restaurant Week menu and got the following things (they came out in this order): -Spicy tuna sushi- This roll was so simple but it was really really good. I felt like they used quality sushi in it. It came with 8 pieces, so perfect to split. -Pork Belly with Kimchi- The pork belly came out on two skewers (3 pieces on each). Once again, great for splitting for two. You really could taste the grilled flavor on it and the kimchi was a perfect additive. Second best pork belly I have had in Charlotte! (Soul will alway be numero uno) -Flank Steak- This was the highlight of the night! The steak was cooked perfectly and the dipping sauce with it was amazing. It also came with two sweet potato pieces.....tasted just like sweet potato casserole! Yum. The portion was pretty well sized I thought for tapas -Salmon- The salmon was good but I think we would have enjoyed it more if it came out before the steak cause I think we were in steak heaven at this point -Orange Creme Brule- My favorite dessert; I just love the caramelized sugar on top! Never had orange before but it actually was super subtle and good -Pineapple tart cake with sorbet- My husband's favorite dessert; It had grilled pineapple on top with a super tasty sorbet  The service was spot on through out and the waiter was very knowledgable about our wine and what would pair with it.   All in all, we will definitely be back but probably only for a special occasion, as the prices were pretty high in comparison to other tapas style places in Charlotte.

7HKLQzsbR42Q-ym4xLAJnQ.text: I went here for my birthday on a Monday night with friends and my boyfriend's coworkers who go here at least once a week because they love it so much. They had half off bottles of wine which was a great way to go for the table. We got a ton of different appetizers, small plates, entrees, etc. to all share. I will admit the miso soup wasn't as warm as I'd like, but the absolute best parts of the meal are the pork belly, the cod, and the salmon. I am not even a big fish person but they are INCREDIBLE. The chocolate dessert was really great too, and overall not a very expensive meal considering how much food we ordered for 6 people. Definitely would recommend it!

pnIU3vK3jyZ_SJGjbQdX-g.text: My husband and I dined here on a last-minute decision for a date night. We had a few places in mind, but were able to get a last-minute reservation and we couldn't have been happier!  We sat upstairs on one of the comfy couches. The vibe of the place was perfect for a date night. Dimly-lit, posh furniture, etc. Our server was excellent. He knew it was out first time there and he walked us through the menus (food and drink) and make several spot-on recommendations.   The cocktails were off-the-hook! I had the Watermelon Basil and French Pear cocktails. My husband had Pom Kasai and French Pear cocktails...they were all fantastic!   For appetizers, we had Gyoza and Pork Belly. We then ordered the Spicy Filet and Kalbi (short ribs) for our second course, along with the Crispy Brussels Sprouts. Each dish was perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork Belly
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pear Cocktail
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Short Ribs

65K7Aq-nwDcGn8U2WNWzgQ.text: Food is incredible. Service is terrible. Ambiance depends on where you are seated.   I could not recommend someone going to Baku after my experience hosting a birthday dinner there. The service was both slow and inconsiderate. Asked for a good warm sake recommendation. Was offered one - $1000 bottle - and when we said we weren't planning to spend that much, were told she didn't have another recommendation to offer. I've enjoyed a lot of sake under $1000 over the years and could not believe she had not. We chose for ourselves, it was brought out on ice instead of warmed and left at the table. After a few minutes we opened it, she came back and softly scolded us, saying that was her job. It was awkward. Then she made a comment that she was interested in knowing what a budget sake tasted like. It was bizarre and ruined our festive vibe. We also waited a little over an hour to receive our sushi. No one ever updated us on our food, so when we finally asked, she just said they were slammed. They really looked pretty wide open on the first floor and our reservation was well after the dinner rush. When the sushi arrived it was delicious, but we couldn't wait to get out of there. We will never come back.

AUwbpwhgfqErtPh_82-Nxw.text: So this is a very very hard review to write because the review is significantly biased by the service. The food and fish quality - unparalleled in charlotte. This is the type of nigiri that I have had in japan. The omakase is a great deal at 40!  But, and this is a huge but, the service was an absolute nightmare. We sat upstairs on a very slow Monday and it took 2+ hours to eat. Absolutely insane. Many many things went wrong too...my husband asked for no wasabi, there was wasabi embedded in each piece. To get it right took about 20-30 min after waiting for 45 min before! And then we asked for separate checks. The waiter didn't do it and told us to just split it 3 ways because that's easier. We said no because we ordered differently. Then he brought the check, all wrong. He already ran one card and said he would run a separate one for the one piece he forgot. This took about 10 min.   And through all of this, not ONCE did he offer to come anything. We were blown away because among 3 people we spent 400 on a Monday night. There are no words. How can this be???  So again, great fish. I'd love to say I'd come back but the service element was beyond reproach. They had multiple chances to fix this and didn't. Also there was someone walking around asking about the service at first but they never came by again even though we went back the food. Very unfortunate.  FYI - since I posted this review, a business manager from the restaurant reached out but nothing to report yet...

Mz-CgR9CMPfChy-yz1uqAw.text: This restaurant could've used a bit of tidying up. Dirty napkins were on the floor and the booth seating was a bit dirty.  This place could use a refresher on the "customer is always right" concept. I prefer super sweet drinks, with little to no trace of a liquor taste. I really enjoyed the first drink I ordered but the second tasted like cough syrup. I was told by a "manager in training" that I would've liked it better without the additional simple syrup. No, I would not have liked a drink that had an even stronger liquor taste than sweet.   The calamari had absolutely no flavor and needed salt. In combination with the dipping sauce, it was tolerable. The rest of the food was great though- lobster rolls, shrimp dumplings, Japanese popcorn chicken.

3AncvBogj1JK-43YQFvbDQ.text: Ok so for the quality of this restaurant it's good but it honestly is overpriced. The only thing I found to be a deal was the omakase desert platter and the omakase nigiri 20 piece platter I believe it was called. Everything else we ordered I honestly can find for the same quality for a lot cheaper.   I was disappointed with our server as well because he was just very apathetic and stone faced and not too attentive with us. We also informed him that it was our anniversary but all he did was say happy anniversary. When we ordered desert I thought there would at least be a candle on it. When we first came in as well the hostess kind of just stared at us a minute and didn't really welcome us.   Just a little frustrated with this place because I've heard so many good things but it also seems like they keep changing the menu and removing things that they were well known for! The food (for example the gyoza) overall I will say again was good. I just wasn't impressed with everything else. The Wagyu is also Japanese and they have a certificate for anyone who wants to verify. The Wagyu roll was also another thing that was a great deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wagyu roll
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked salmon belly
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu cover

cuUmlOo-Itrlqt6azFVCjw.text: We came for a team dinner and it was pretty easy to get a table. The service is very kind and attentive. There is even a sake connoisseur who gave us a great selection (Azure).   All the rolls were great. I suggest the Korean spicy tuna. All the appetizers are fantastic. Can't wait to come back!

1ebXlOeZeHviu65whugWgg.text: "Broke da mouth" local Hawaiians say when the food is exceptionally scrumptious.  Came from Hawaii and new resident of NC, it's very hard to find good Japanese cuisine.  Although, Baku was pretty fusion-esk , but they kept traditional Japanese izakaya and sushi cuisine.   The chef marinated sushi - you don't need to dip sushi in shoyu (soy sauce).   Otoro was exceptional! The cut of sashimi was amazing. No sinew.  Uni - ikura- hamachi. You name it, all were amazing.  Our server was amazing. She was very helpful with menu and very attentive.   I will look forward to come back here.  The only constructive criticism I have here, the sushi rice was over cooked.  Now, the rice is critical and also big part of sushi, nigiri.   But one overdone batch can happen.   I really enjoyed Baku.   I recommend if you want good sushi.   Fyi 1 uni spoon is $21.  Giving heads up

zjnLlYyQmwMONVN4OmtctA.text: I'm a fan of more intimate, low key, sushi-centric sushi spots, but you can't really get that in Charlotte.  I will say, however, Baku is by far the best sushi spot I've been to in Charlotte so for that, it might even deserve 5 stars (for Charlotte).  It's a bit of a trek from Uptown, but totally worth it for a large party (12) like we had.  My expectations started off a bit low given this place didn't seem all that authentic Japanese to me, but I was surprised at how good some of the food was.  They had a couple guys waiting our table and the service was fast and comprehensive.  They did a great job taking our orders and providing food in a timely and organized manner.  I also checked the receipt like I always do at large events to make sure everything checked out and it did.  As for the food, we ordered so many things on the menu I can't even begin to remember what all we ate.  However, the following stood out to me:  Uni - actually I was super surprised at how fresh the uni was here.  You get a pretty decent serving if you choose to have it "sashimi" style.  The stuff melted in my mouth and honestly.... this was really good uni - coming from myself and a coworker who both love uni  Baku yellowtail - crunchy spicy yellowtail, avocado, topped with yellowtail and serrano pepper - favorite roll of the night (and we pretty much ordered them all)  The pork belly skewers were actually a stand out also - this stuff basically melted in your mouth and was the perfect crispy on the outside melty on the inside consistency.  10/10 would order again.  Things I would skip - calamari and karaage.  Both batters were a bit strange for me and weren't special compared to other things on the menu.  Great for groups, worth the trek from Uptown for a meal.

Cg8hmN7dcMKF1WsqI5-LOg.text: Amazing dinner and date night! The Tuna with Flash fried onions was so good we ordered an extra one after our meal. Love the beignets and our server Sam was a Gem! Definitely recommend!

pLeHX2svNKEk6TFBg0HWSQ.text: From start to finish this was an amazing experience. In the 3 years I've lived in Charlotte this is definitely in my top 2 meals I have had. Our waiter, Michael S, made our visit over the top. We kinda told him what we liked and he crafted our meal around that. We had 2 apps and 3 rolls and everything was absolutely amazing! Dessert, beignets absolutely made this meal complete. I have had plenty of sushi in this city and this was definitely my favorite. I can not wait to come back and try some more. It was expensive, but I find you get what you pay for. This was worth every penny.

WUUY62vkkeMflfA5JAnPpQ.text: First time visiting Baku and it was absolutely tasty! Michael was extremely attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. He's very welcoming.  Try the brussel sprouts, you wont regret it.

4NbZEEETj8R5njjskPRB0A.text: I'm so disappointed in this place. My experience started off ok but It went downhill fast. Our waiter started off really nice but as the problems mounted, he started losing his cool too. And the restaurant wasn't even that busy, especially considering it's a Friday night during restaurant week.   I came with a party of 7 and we all ordered the Queens Feast plus a couple extra dishes since I read several reviews of small portions. Four people in my party ordered calamari. Only three of us received It. I asked the waiter twice about It and It never came. After everyone was done with their meal and was ready to order dessert, I told the waiter again that I didn't get the calamari. Finally It arrives but it's salty and oily. The remoulade served with It was bland, basically pink colored mayonnaise. The worst part? They didn't clean the calamari right and i ended up with a chunk of the cartilage in my teeth. One star off for the late appetizer and the cartilage. Yuck!   The other dishes ranged from ok to delicious. I knocked off another star for the food since the bad outweighed the good.   The good:  NY strip steak was cooked perfectly and came with rice, asparagus and a dipping sauce. All were scrumptious!  The Dragon Roll was perfect. I substituted the salmon for shrimp tempura (I must be the only sushi lover in the world that hates raw salmon) and It was so good. The eel was bbq'd perfectly, the avocado was ripe and creamy and the little bite of asian pear gave A nice crunch.   The bad:  Edamame was served without salt but with sweet chili sauce that did not pair well to me and tasted like It came right out of a bottle.  Pork belly was very fatty. I was expecting a crispy texture but It was super soft and gelatinous. I wouldn't order It again.  The hamachi was served with pickled onions- all you could taste was vinegar. Straight up vinegar.  The beignets were the same fried donuts you'd get at any standard Chinese takeout except they rolled it in cinnamon sugar and served It over icing. It was very dense and heavy.   The manager came out and comped desserts to make up for me not receiving the appetizer in time. But this was done while we were waiting for dessert. Several minutes later, only two of the four ordered beignets came out. We asked for our checks, paid and signed the receipts and still missing two desserts. We finally asked for them to go. The waiter went back and forth with us saying we only ordered two beignets, not four. But everyone at our table heard each person order.  Mark off another star for that awkward argument.   I received a gift certificate for my next visit but I don't see myself going back any time soon. Even with the Queens Feast special, the food was not worth the price and the service is lacking.

oNBTPdJX26QhFSHMHQQsDw.text: The service was absolutely wonderful. Sam was great, from start to finish. She explained the menu thoroughly and gave perfect recommendations. The pork belly was cooked ideally, marinated in a miso sauce for 24hrs and melted in your mouth. The sushi preparations were beautiful and the fish tasted very fresh! What a great first experience!

KyHzve8bYGTSUqeufZ0aIA.text: For real though...I love food and travel for work a lot. My favorite US sushi has been in LA, NY and Honolulu. There are other decent places, but not really AMAZING places...until Baku.   My friends told me about Baku, but I didn't want to listen... I found it hard to believe, but we went anyways and they were spot on.   The restaurant is adorable and nicely appointed. We ate upstairs. There's hardwood floors and a cool bar up. Our service was wonderful.   First round: filthy martini, pear drink, and wine for the three of us  First round food:  Brussels Sprouts: amazing, mostly broken up into chips and fried. A sweet sauce, which I actually could do without Pork belly: fab! Great sauce Short ribs: seemed underdone at first, but actually were a table favorite  Bang bang shrimp: had the shrimp inside and it was yummy  Second round:  Otoro: melt on the tongue also, our waiter shared a picture of the fish it was from which was cool  Chilean Seabass: delicious... Shu Mai: we didn't love this, but it was good...just shrimp in dumpling paper...not as flavorful as the pork shu Mai we are used to

MSIeAHy7mffRBSRbaFj-4Q.text: Such an awesome place! Been coming for years! Love the food and the atmosphere. Something new: their sake advisor, Sarah was so knowledgeable and helpful in making our sake selections. I love sake, so having someone who is passionate and well versed in sake is amazing and SO RARE! SO impressed!   Fan Favs:  Hamachi Rice Crispy Treats  Sweet Corn Salmon Belly Nigiri  Tempura Rock Shrimp Black Miso Cod   Worth the splurge: Japanese A-5 Wagyu

4VE8yirjARFCM8TSEuRiRQ.text: The manager needs to have a chat with the bartender named Taylor. She just really put a huge damper on our dining experience last night.   Here's the thing, I've worked restaurant week. I did it for years and I get it... it's not fun. It's a different flow at work for nicer restaurants. Servers are used to working 3-6 tables and making bank. Restaurant week means double the work for the same money. I get that BUT with that being said your customers should not hear you complain about it. You are still at your job, be professional. You are also still making money so again stop complaining like you are so spoiled! This is twice a year, you can do it!  During our dining experience last night we were sat at a high top table around the bar. Colton greeted us quickly but not before I heard we heard a group of servers saying they hope they can make it through this night if hell. Colton was very kind and offered suggestions to us. He didn't make us feel guilty for wanting to indulge in the RW menu. We ordered a few drinks and started sipping on those but very quickly got distracted by Taylor talking to a couple at the bar. Complaining about the clientele of restaurant week. "It's the absolute worst! It's a good thing you guys got here before the wolves come out to play tonight". I'm completely appalled that a server would speak like this openly. WAIT IT GETS WORSE!!! A gentlemen came to our table to refill waters and I thanked him for working during restaurant week while acknowledging that we understand it's more stressful than the norm. The waiter then started to rant about how they normally run an average of $90 a person so this $35 a person menu is horrible. "We all hate it", he said to me and my husband. We heard Taylor at the bar speak ill about the week two more times during our meal.   Colton got really busy at the bar and our service suffered because of it. We spent a lot more than just "restaurant week money". We ordered an additional sushi roll and several drinks. I also am from the service industry so we tip well and are understanding about elements that effect service but were disappointed overall.  Notes on the food: For the 3 course meal my husband and I both selected the Yellowtail starter. I was under impressed by this. WAY TO MUCH RADISH! Second course my husband got the Hamachi Rice Crispy Treat and I got the pork dumplings, these were good but they all came out with the Yellowtail in the matter of a minute. We were trying to enjoy our evening and they should have courses this out for us. We could also tell that the rice crispy wasn't cooked to order, it was cold. For our main course we both got the NY strip cooked to Medium Rare. The strip was a great portion size and came with a few pieces of asparagus and wait MORE RADISH. We both enjoyed the steak flavor. We got the Dragon roll in addition to the RW menu and we liked this, very fresh surprise with the pear inside of the roll.   I would have loved to give this experience a few more stars but service is a HUGE part of a guest experience and it really impacted our evening. HAVE A CHAT WITH THE STAFF ABOUT THEIR ATTITUDES AND PROFESSIONALISM!

Ru6yoxxDLb1li6GOASG5Uw.text: Hands down the beat sushi I have ever had. Every single one is amazing. Servers are knowledgeable and complimentary. They have a full bar with a great liquor selection. Yes the price point is a little higher than some but it's TOTALLY worth it.

BvkHvf641u2RAN1TgdRRoQ.text: I originally tried Baku during restaurant week here in Charlotte and was very pleasantly surprised. My friend and I had so much food and even tried the yummy cocktails. I enjoyed this place so much that I've been raving about it since to my partner who took me here for date night last night.   Basically I was slightly underwhelmed considering my first experience.  The service was impeccable but unfortunately the food was a little disappointing. One of my favorite dishes is the crispy Brussels sprouts and the first order came out kinda burned instead of charred. Then I ordered the beef skewers and honestly the texture and flavor was very weird. During restaurant week I ordered the skirt steak and asparagus and that's definitely a better choice. The calamari was amazing though this time it was a little more rubbery than previously and finally the chicken good but also not as crispy. Idk what was up with Baku last night but we were literally like the first people there around 5:30pm.   Rating 4 stars mostly because of my first experience with food and my second experience with the server. Will try again and hopefully the food is consistent.

dsgzOuZ2xzqSpmaKtpuITg.text: I came here to celebrate my mother's birthday, and well we had to do it pretty big. There's some things you just have to get here, and it should be required. I think if you're going to spend money on sushi and normal items that you can get anywhere else...you can, but just know there are a lot of other things on the menu that you're missing out. Let's just say I didn't do much ordering, as my brother mostly had that on lock since he knew what was good and wasn't.  What did we eat... Good question. Let's just say it was an assortment of food and the quality were all great. I'll go through each photo, but to be honest, the otoro is what you should look at getting (the picture that's on the ice). I think that dish is amazing especially just the experience of it. There are all these other options as well, but to me that one stood out.   The restaurant is a little dark, but it's going for the lounge/romantic setting which I understand. We sat upstairs next to the bar and it was pretty comfortable. If you're looking for a good solid sushi/japanese restaurant and it's for a special occasion, I would definitely suggest that Baku would be on that list.

Ic_eZUtS7O5vZi9vgrs6WA.text: This is hands down the best restaurant in Charlotte. Yes it's expensive. Yes the portion sizes are small and you need to order a good amount of food to feel full but that's what a fine dining restaurant is like (which Charlotte is not too familiar with). The food is amazing especially their wagyu beef and Nigiri. However, their dessert chocolate cake tasted like the instant Betty Crocker stuff. I will still let that slide as the appetizers and main course and the service were exceptional. Also loved the contemporary feel. If this restaurant closes there really will be no options in this city next time I want a fancy night out.

2La7hXTpRwv08KbUxLlIMQ.text: Came for restaurant week last night. It was busy but with our reservation we were sat immediately. Our server Dave was awesome. He was nice and attentive and very informative about the menu. The food was delicious. Brussels sprouts were amazing but so was the pork belly skewer!! Well definitely be back!!

IsUTBYc9neQ1eD8jeShAzg.text: I have heard several compliments about Baku so I was happy to finally make it out.  I love the different concept of Baku as I have never experienced a Japanese Kobata grill before.    That night, I ordered the soft shell crab special, which is in season and was flown in that day.  It was my favorite dish of the night.    For a sushi sample, I tried the mushroom roll with the truffle oil.  It was ok.  I originally wanted to Forbidden roll and should have gone with that.   I also ordered the grilled tofu skewers and a side dish of kimchee.  Both were excellent and could make a meal on their own.  After all that I ate, I did not have room for dessert, but I saw the wonderful dessert platters on ice coming out of the kitchen and wish I had room to try one.

arf9imSe2inVetW068GTDA.text: Pricy but worth it. Presentation is good, staff are friendly, foods are delicious. Only criticism is too much vinegar for oyster, which is quite small, but the oyster is in good quality and watermelon fruity sauce is refreshing and tasty. Sea urchin is delicious, it's from Cali not Japan but still very good quality. Chef's choice sashimi is totally worth it! Will definitely visit again. Best of the day is WASABI is fresh made!!!! I really appreciate having the fresh wasabi! Most of the Japanese restaurants are using wasabi powder or mix with fresh. At here, only fresh made wasabi!!

Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ny strip. Tasty as its own but good with sea salt and wasabi.

XjiBP8_rWYTseiFAQHNSEg.text: Halloween night dinner!   I wanted to pick a fun place for dinner that would have a festive theme - but I wanted something different. Baku was it. They had a DJ set up that gave the upstairs area a fun vibe, and there were a handful of people dressed up.   I made reservations and my party was seated at a comfortable table behind the bar. We noted the cool decor along with a few funky Halloween items.   The wine list is neat: they have a few unusual items. I tried the Bollini Pinot Grigio, and my friends took part in the specials. The prices were fair on drinks - this is a nice place in a great location so don't expect dive-bar prices.   The food comes in a tapas/sharing style. I split the Robata skewer of tofu, and the Tempura Rock Shrimp. My other friends had the salmon, dumplings, sushi, and it all looked really good! On the next trip, I plan to try some of the substantial dinner plates.  With the way they made the tofu taste awesome, I'm excited to see what else they have to offer.  The waitress was very attentive to our large, festive group, and kept checking on us between her other tables. Even though it was a busy night, the service was consistently good.  I'm planning on coming again.

wVxbf_As6BSk9M1j-pCr0A.text: I have always passed by this place and finally decided to go there on a Friday night. I was impressed when I first walked in. It definitely one of the nicest restaurant I've seen. I ordered some sushi, the chef made it looked really nice and it was delicious. They also have a bar upstairs which I didn't get a chance to experience but it looked really nice. I will be back for that next time.

UmKYC7gyPMxmQBRtZJic1g.text: Umm.  This place.  I can't knock the good as was really quite good.  A bit over done on presentation which they certainly charge for.    The Izikaya style of restaurant is indeed small plates for sharing which I live.  Baku have joined Izikaya with fine dining. In my opinion this does not work.  Supposed to be inexpensive and pub type atmosphere which Baku is neither.   The waiters are well trained and well informed but this does not help the sell.  They don't help you organize the order very well.    Ok Ok.  In short. Great food, pretentious attitude and over the top setting.  May suit some but if I am going to pay for and wish to have fine dining. I will do just that, not try for the casual sharing experience of Izikaya in a pompous setting.   Good is great but will not return. Sorry.  Unless they lighten up.  Let me know.   Best.    SC.

dqTu40GwklAVpuqaSqMNpA.text: The food was good, but the waiter was disgusting.  There was an entree that sold per person, and it said "minimum 3 persons". I asked the waiter that if I can order this for two, he said yes.  But eventually he charge me as 3, without any explanation and informing.  I checked the bill, asked him, then he told me that there was something wrong with the POS machine, and he didn't notice that.  But hi poor acting skill told me he knew everything.  Will never go this place again.

c_lQdEXVu2YByxkE4Dvisg.text: We LOVED our experience! Food was incredible, a True work of art, very fresh! Drinks we're great and our server was very informative. The only downside was that the music was a little too loud! Other than that, amazing experience. We will be back

PS_YsG5mQBQ9GqdmoZYxfw.text: Went here for a girls night out and was definitely worth it! Ambience was perfect and noise level wasn't too bad. Seems like A great spot for a ni ch the out with friends or date night.  Come with a larger group to share dishes, more of a social setting. Warm towels to start the meal is a tradition I could get used to. Drink list was crafty and tasty. Food, no words do it justice...scrumptious to say the least! Will be back.

0zFyVazy3mtOJ1IX2n-nFQ.text: We always wanted to try this place and finally went on a Friday night and was definitely not worth time/money and it just ruined our dinner. We ordered chicken green onion yakatori and shrimp tempura roll.  We got our order after ~20min of wait. Shrimp tempura roll tasted fine. But chicken yakatori tasted like over burnt "wood". Then ordered "king crab pot", which came in a fancy pot but no taste to it all(It was priced for $17, but it was not even worth 2$ and I would pay those 2$ for that fancy pot and would not pay a dime for the food). So, I would suggest not to get attracted by the fancy exterior of this place, there are dozens of better food places near by Baku, try them.( in those other places, at least you might not feel like you got ripped off)

tZEkXk4fF0ZKWIdJ54CpNg.text: Worst place in town.  DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY.  My family and I made reservations for my birthday.  It was our first time trying out the place.  Our reservation was for 7:45 pm.  We arrived on time and was told by the host our table would be ready shortly.  We moved to the side and waited.  We waited five minutes... ten minutes... fifteen minutes... twenty minutes... twenty-five minutes... thirty minutes.  Still did not get our so-called reserved seat.    Meanwhile, other guests who walked in the door with no reservations got sat almost immediately.  What's the point of making a reservation at this establishment?  They will take reservations but they will not honor them.  We complained to the manager, who didn't apologize or made any attempts at trying to reconcile the situation.  The blonde female host is completely unprofessional and rude.  They all need a course in How-To-Be-A-Civil-Person 101.  We left. We don't plan on going there ever again.  F*** you, Baku.  P.S.  We also witnessed one of the line cooks literally blowing on the food he was cooking, while it was on the grill - spit and everything.  It must be the secret ingredient.

1LquPa_C0vOt5Z_2RYbzmQ.text: Best sushi in Charlotte:  Tiger shrimp Blue fin toro tartare Spicy hamachi rice crispy treat Big hourany roll Salmon belly nigiri

IkrksafHvQnALDgRWwzRRQ.text: Seriously, I love this place.   Charlotte is a wasteland of decent food options. I have lived here for eight years, and when I took my out of town parents here, my dad replied it was the first good dinner he'd had in Charlotte.   We us amazing sushi, chicken meatballs, ribeye, black cod, and the edamame. All were yummy. The only miss was the crab hot pot.   Get the cod. Get two. You'll be happy you did.   Also, sit upstairs if possible. They have a better atmosphere.

qw4-hCROvs_lPmBXwdjGuA.text: This place is pretty unique. Everything tastes good and the service is good as well. But they will make your pocket hurt. It's way too pricey for the amount of food they bring. Maybe I will come back someday, but I will check other places before.

yWg7LlGsjSSdfFQQulWw9Q.text: WOW. We loved EVERY single dish served. Fantastic. All fresh, wonderfully seasoned.  Pork belly , dumplings, calamari, lobster rolls, edamame and good drinks. Try it!!!

K_rlTth5xjtSQiIBCe1f4Q.text: Great food, the selection is truly great, you can get in and out for a reasonable price or you can go all out and splurge. We had the pork belly, sushi, and giant prawn.  All very well done.  Incredible cocktails and the best saki selection I've ever seen.  I'll definitely do it again.

k11A5dSucAmvoaOAMg5YKg.text: Very disappointed with our experience. If you are looking for an overpriced meal with poor service then this is the place for you.

mu9xKs71Y1XnREYim2Lg5Q.text: Had a party of 10 for a team dinner so all of the food was pre ordered. It was served tapas style and we had about 10 different rounds. All the food was excellent and the staff was very friendly. There was a wide variety of food and all was fresh and flavorful. We sat upstairs and it did get a bit loud but there were several other parties so the atmosphere was about right. If your into tapas than I recommend Baku but if your looking for a traditional meals, this may not be the place for you.

HOArpHdHXDsa_F8oIwCC9g.text: Charlottes new hot spot. Great Japanese food and super cool lounge upstairs. The food is incredible and fun to share.  The duck is a must have!!!@

uxmmOQrG0amPH088b4qP-Q.text: Baku is unique, the decor, the presentation, service, and who cares about all that if the food isn't dazzling, it's very expensive, but it's worth the price, my hat is off for the Chefs and their crew.  If your wallet has some weight to shed pay a visit, you won't regret.

uekwljIdfwNGRHhG4H_aEg.text: Terrible service, over priced food and very small portions. We had to go to the bar ourselves to get drinks. Should have just left!

VZGvYNL7INtr2NAyEvLDvA.text: Pretty place, pretty food, way over-priced, condescending service ....a place where the hostesses and servers think they are very hot. We dine out a lot, in cities all over the country, and have never been treated so rudely.  There are at least 10 restaurants within a mile of this one that provide a much better dining experience.

YmQZ123qX9B4my3wZS5DqQ.text: Had a great dinner with my wife, sushi was excellent as was the wagyu beef tartare, and tuna tartare. Was disappointed with the desert menu though.

CH7YJ4xVx6BjRqaOiV9NZA.text: So delicious!  Very unique food!  The meats are super tender, the sushi is on point and the cocktails are amazing!  Definitely one of the best meals we've had in Charlotte!  We got the pork belly skewers (super rich and great flavor), roasted oysters, Hamachi sushi roll, black cod, and lamb chops.  Everything was perfect!!  Ambiance was good too, not pretentious.  Don't be afraid to ask for a different table if you get seated in a really dark spot!

lSpfG6KeISTo8NfgsarFBw.text: We went for restaurant week and still walked out with a bill over $100. The waiter we had was great. He gave lots of good information and was attentive. The food was just okay. It lacked flavor for the most part and we thought it was overpriced for what you get. Also, for the sushi rolls...if you are going to charge $20 for a roll then you should be using the correct rice. Lastly, the hostesses were not very welcoming. When we walked in there were 3 hovered around the hostess stand chatting. We had to get their attention so we could be seated. There were no smiles are how are you doing tonight. The hostesses are a restaurants first impression and the last. Make sure they are friendly so patrons return. Unfortunately we probably won't be back.

ySdvflvkMqlGeOzBe9NNVQ.text: RESTAURANT WEEK RIP OFF: Poor service for our party of 6. Two people served salad then we waited, then one person got calamari, then we waited, then one person got sushi, and then we waited then another person got sushi and the sixth person got nothing...after a while waiter went down to kitchen to bring another salad. THEN, repeat style of service all 6 entrees brought at different time and waiter told us we were supposed to share!?  At the same time we had poor service, there were 7 loud very drunk men making so much noise you could not have any conversation at all. They were adults pouring sake into wine glasses, into beer and making impossible to hear anything. Waiter said he told management, but nothing changed. They finished their meal and continued to bar to drink and shout at the top of their voices. Oh and the portion size...miniscule. Does this restaurant think it will last in Charlotte!  We may be  very polite, but we do not take rip off's very well.   If you have a reservation here for restaurant week, Cancel it!

u07Jd6DSOUMLwKU-jVQ-ug.text: Yum!  Date night heaven.  My husband and I came here a couple weeks back and it was delicious!  We ordered several dishes, mostly from the special menu but everything was tasty.  The sushi was super fresh but in my opinion over priced. The dumpling were tasty!  The sake was really good but overpriced.  The mark up was too much for what I know wasn't an expensive bottle.  The butterfish was very tasty as well and I would order it again.  Everything was pretty good but overpriced to me... Coming from New York I think that says something.  I don't want to take away from the food because it was good but not super special to explain the prices.  Perhaps we were paying for the atmosphere which was very nice.  Our server was nice but didn't offer any suggestions which wasn't super helpful but that was okay because everything was tasty.  We will come again when we want to spend a lot on some decent sushi

FE4h9XMrb3ZQoEXHFJVAGA.text: My fiance and I came to Baku for the first time on my birthday. The service was wonderful and food presentation was excellent. We ordered the pork dumplings, chicken wings, spicy tuna roll, and the butter fish. Everything was just ok. Asian food is my favorite cuisine. I have eaten at Asian restaurants all over the country and this is one of the lowest on my list. Maybe the chef was off tonight, I don't know, but he or she must not have been tasting the food. During dinner we even starting discussing what we were going to eat when we got home. Unfortunately this visit was a fail for us, and we may not be coming back.

OnmMYg46vVJjwydRpd5DHg.text: Amazing food, excellent service and a very cool atmosphere.  I will say that it is VERY pricey.  For a full meal with wine/drinks, starters, etc I would say this is just as expensive as The Palm, Capital Grill, etc...  It's definitely with trying and if on a budget just  look for more reasonably priced small pates and rolls.

12FkjsKXdeKJUBJyv8iiFg.text: My hubby and I went here for our anniversary dinner and were very excited. When we arrived we were led to a tiny table upstairs near the bar. Maybe that was the issue? Anyway, the service was terrible. Our waiter did not describe the menu at all; no explanation of how the small plates work, etc.  My hubby and I knew what questions to ask, but the waiter didn't seem to know the menu, or just didn't care.  Anyway, we saw him once after that.  The food was ok, but bland; nothing to go back for. As a former sever myself, I am usually very understanding when a restaurant is busy, and my hubs and I really don't expect much except to be checked on periodically....we didn't even get that, and the restaurant was not busy.  Anyway, we won't be back, but maybe they just had an off night? The drinks were good though, hence the two stars!

PqHP_4T__wqO2ZEVHjQfdg.text: Best restaurant in Charlotte.  Try the ribs, tempura shrimp, pork dumplings and New York strip.  You won't be disappointed.  Great cocktails.

ZY1iVAqTubtFkr012caHAw.text: This was my initial visit to this place and I found it wanting.   If you don't drink like my wife and I there is really not much on the menu for you.  When we went there was a total of 4 pages of food on them menu this was a whole book.   The food left us looking for something to balance out the salt and our water was not doing much.   The plates of food were small and the food to price value is low.  The food was fair to good at best.  I have had better for the price.

oTZqFnU8RjrvEFNUlzDqdA.text: On the positive side, our server was phenomenal. Michael went above and beyond to create our dining experience. Second and last positive is the reasonably priced wine and decent selection. The food is good, we did not have a bad dish. Our table of 6 ate tapas style and ate a wide variety from the edamame (delicious chili sauce) to the wagu beef. Unfortunately this is challenging because the portions are so small. Although they encourage tapas sharing, the dishes are barely appropriate for 2 to share. The food did not rock my world, but it was good. Then the bill came. For a table of 6 to spend $1,000 including gratuity, I would expect to be eating Nobu quality food. I have no problem paying for a meal that is outstanding, once in a lifetime experience. Unfortunately, that is not Baku in Southpark. Outrageously priced food.  Unfortunately we will not be back. Ever.

cgfligfzv494KR04RkX74w.text: Not great. REALLY EXPENSIVE... there are half a dozen restaurants that do something better for cheaper. I honestly thought it was a joke restaurant.

om2QctRqM0TaXcHqlBFnFQ.text: A new Izakaya restaurant, very posh and upscale.    I expected an izakaya to be less formal and less stiff. More of a watering hole for the tired salaryman but this place has turned the local watering hole into a semi-formal dining establishment. Lots of uniformed waiters, a sake sommelier, a valet.. its just a wierd vibe for an izakaya.  The clientele is all dressed up for dinner, in heels and all. Kinda snobby.  Service is impeccable. They will take very good care of you. Our server was cordial and attentive.  We just about ate everything on the menu. Even had their Nanbu Bijin Dai Ginjo. Kitchen is fast. Our skewers came very quickly.  The best is the scallops and prok belly. So good, we asked for 2 more plate. The Omakase, at $60 for 3 was expensive.  There simply wasn't enough to justify $60 for 3.  I would say the portion was enough for 1 person.  All the other plates were OK.  Nothing too spectacular.  Sake list is good. They had a few bottles from JunMai to DaiGinjo. We had the KiKuSui , which came is such a small 300ml bottle is was pathetic. We stepped up and got the $150 Nanbu Bijin that was much better. The next time , I would ask them to sit the bottle in a bed of ice. I kinda like my sake colder.  Anyway, its not your typical relaxed, let your hair down, end of the day, drop your butt down and drink your tired day away of an Izakaya.  People actually dress up and come here to be seen. Sorta different vibe, sorta pretentious..but damn good service.  It is on the pricey side.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nanbu Bijin. Daiginjo!

0szhvXvTL1KXighruSOJwQ.text: Great dinner experience at Baku. Our server Anthony was friendly, prompt and very informative. My favorite dish was the waygu tartare followed by the duck. The nigiri and dragon roll was also very good. I'd definitely suggest trying the pork belly skewers. The pork dumplings were the only item that didn't impress me. I love the decor and atmosphere.  It is on the pricey side considering the portions but you're paying for quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Truffles
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Duck
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dragon roll

hixzfKyR_7IhFRVMIo5ZAA.text: the decor is nice, kind of upscale rustic.  I love the sound panels on the ceiling.  what a great idea.  The food... Grouper Bites... a bit oily, not crisped up, but still tasty.  I also loved the green tea-infused salt.  That was new and interesting.    Pork Dumplings, again, oily, and a little thick in the skin, chewy.    Tenderloin Skewer...sort of bland.  The pricing is what I'd expect for Charlotte, but I don't think the food rates those prices.  We sat at the bar downstairs, which is a nice bar, but smaller.  Our bartenders were very nice but one bartender was really loud and he would make loud comments about what he was watching on sports center and when he was chatting with other staff it was obtrusive.  Also in the bar area... everyone from the kitchen staff, managers, hostesses... would come behind the bar to fill up their drinks, get ice, check out what was going on on sports center, chat....  It was really a bit irritating.  The bar isn't that big and although I would choose to sit further away from the tv side if I'm eating at the bar next time - it was just odd that it is set up that way.  I recommend people try it and I definitely want to sit upstairs next time.

nEvxzvaFr8NcdtwBxFUPCg.text: Get the pork belly! It's so flavorful and so well cooked that I don't think I've had better. You won't be disappointed.   Service was great too, considering we went on a weekend. Our waiter Bob was extremely patient with our group. He explained what was currently popular for us to try.   Anyway, I can't wait to go back with my friend's birthday coming up!

FdRb7r55r0tsLQBgrzj8Hw.text: I want to start my review by saying that their reservation system is the worst. The reason I say that is because you will never see the time slot of 7-8:30 available to book a spot. I reserved a table for four at 6:30 and saw many empty tables while we dining until when we were leaving around 8:30. Now, the food: it is a very small limited menu so not sure what the hype is about. The dragon roll was my favorite and lychee martini was delicious. It is an overpriced place that lacks service (second round of drinks took forever to come) and variety in menu. I would likely not return here, we paid 200 some dollars for four people and  still left hungry and unsatisfied food wise specifically

p6o_-3a23tQmPAr1-JPyIw.text: Baku ,this has been our"go to" spot and best place to dine since coming here for visiting , Do not let the prices on the menu hold you back ,The establishment and the layout is phenomenal and the dining area is expansive.  And their dishes were exceptional .very creative and eye enticing .we can't remember everything we had (not good at naming dishes ) but basically ,everything was very unique and top notch .if u r a dessert fan ,(like me )definitely try their Yuzu Tart and Akuma (Pistachio Gelato) ,service was a bit slow but still on point .

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Akuma
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yuzu Tart
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yuzu tart( toasted Almond Crumble)&amp; Akuma (Pistachio Gelato)

utkbvEiXIkx8Z0zVtp87EA.text: A group of friends tried BAKU during Queensfeast/restaurant week.  Service here was wonderful and food was delicious.  We had one mistake during the evening and it was a steak not being cook according to ordered.  The wait staff and management could not have been any nicer and fixed it immediately.   We will definitely go again

bsCB7fkW-n_GN-GlKelXWg.text: I really wish I could give Baku a 4 or even 5 star review, but the service we just had was pretty disappointing. We went in for Queen's Feast Restaurant Week, and everything we ate was pretty tasty. We added on the pork belly skewers per our server's recommendation, and it was delicious! The biggest issue here was attentiveness of our waiter. He was very friendly and enthusiastic, however, it wasn't even that busy, yet we frequently ran out of water. We also asked about sake when we placed our order, yet the expert did not come around to explain until the end of our meal. One of our dishes was forgotten, and we had to remind him we ordered it. Worst of all, when we were ready to leave, it was very difficult to get the check, and we had to even ask another waiter to ring it up for us. Again, the food was above average, but overall, we expected better service.  Update: After writing this review, my boyfriend went to Whole Foods to buy a sandwich because he was still hungry. Not exactly what you want after a $100+ meal.

i18Xhid0_N3jLKy6UNcL0A.text: This is my favorite Japanese restaurant! I had the dragon roll while my husband had their famous baby rack ribs and once again Baku amazed us! We were treated so nicely and the owner took the time to explain the menu and enhance our experience. We're bringing our friends next weekend for our double date and we're sure they'll be impressed. Can't wait to eat there again.

1AnSIsju-nfSsM31AUGCsg.text: It is absolutely blowing my mind that this place doesn't have the 5 star rating it deserves. Every single thing we have ever had here, every time we come, is AMAZING! If you're a fan of Soul (in plaza Midwood), or O-ku in atherton mill, then you will LOVE what this place has to offer. Fantastic selection of apps (the tartare and the tempura cod bites are out of this world good), and the prices are reasonable IMO. There's almost never a wait either, so that's a huge plus. I'm not sure what's up with the other people (maybe they consider Applebees good eats), but from one foodie to another, this place is a must try.

DWkfJB24q0sOt7M5_oKNvg.text: This evening was my 5th time dining at Baku. The last few occasions I have dined here the food and service have been impeccable. Easily Baku has been in my top 5 choices for dinner in Charlotte, especially on special occasions. Tonight was quite a diversion from the norm. Focally there were multiple items not available, Shishito Peppers, several other appetizers, and a few entrees. In the past we had been captivated by the Tomahawk steak and Wagyu beef. Well understanding that the other entrees were "tapas" portions, for the money it was a bit meager. One of the six in our party ordered diver scallops, which sets the expectation they should be large. Unfortunately they missed expectations and were small. With all of the absent dishes the flavor of the dishes and service are the only reason I am giving 3 stars. I heard the menu is being updated, but still not a good enough reason for having so many missing dishes. Lastly if it weren't for the aforementioned positives I would have rated tonight a 1 or a 2. I hope these issues are temporary and I look forward to possibly giving it another try soon.

zpvaEjexGPiUw3rxsfoHsw.text: Great food and service ! Went last weekend for dinner with families and friends! everyone was very satisfied with the food especially the sushi is to die for ! Food is fresh and great quality ! Will definitely come back next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States

IpJC9j6ln2A2YpnHTUYQeg.text: I sat with Chad at the Sushi Bar and had a memorable meal. I tried so hard to enjoy every bite, it was so flavorful. Salmon tataki, Wagyu tartare, black cod are MUST haves.  Chad was awesome, exceptional service all around, great menu, nice wine selection. This place ranks up there with some of the best restaurants in San Fran and NYC.  Just go!

Ro87lrU_4sATYV2uqI4syw.text: This is a very pretentious dump, designed to impress the socialites who neither value money or service. Apparently "Baku" is Japanese for tiny little portions that we charge way too much for. There were a total of four tables sitting yet we had to constantly wait for service... I had to get up at one point to wave down our server to get another $22 drink. The only positive is that what little food we got was actually pretty good, and the servers were all friendly.

i748uRg_4B1bg4ZEVLjPCw.text: Being Japanese, I know sushi and this sushi wasn't top notch. The butterfish wasn't "buttery" but hard to chew. It wasn't super flavorful. However, the cooked items were delicious, notably the cod and scallop dumplings. The sauces for the skewers were great, but again not sure about the quality of everything. Food presentation was great.
