JLC7AmAjMO7aqKqRsKFiKw.text: Overpriced and just ok food. Rock shrimp was good. We ordered the yellow tail, it cost $16 and there was 3 bite size pieces. Not worth the money.

Iw-ubqL6RGvytuLIrkHSDA.text: Baku isn't bad. You pay for the ambiance for sure. I loved it inside, made for a great date night.  There isn't a big parking lot so that's a con. We went for an early dinner and found a spot easily. I'd suggest that. Our service was great, and our food was great. Not too much more you could ask for.

OQCAaNmRH_CNzyDEHtpDAQ.text: This is my first yelp review. The manager knows me as the middle aged business woman that was trying to enjoy a meal with clients before being shouted profanities at by a neighboring table -- words I've never had directed at me before. Management did nothing.

TJ9HNH6WkvIx4fAD93exnQ.text: The good: the food was really delicious. The bad, waited at least 30 mins for the food to be served and served us the wrong food. We did the omakase thing where the chef chooses the dishes to be served.

4YX5206mrw-COEqSCeAr7A.text: Cool ambiance, lots of variety on the menu, but pretty pricey.   It's a tapas place so things come out of the kitchen at different times regardless of when you order.   A few items everyone should order: the pork belly just melts in your mouth, asparagus nice presentation tastes even better than it looks, sweet corn definitely for sharing, black cod small portion but super delicious, chicken meatballs sauces are so tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Special - scallops with foie gras
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet corn

jtwRyf0lP9lgqTgQsx1hMA.text: A recent encore visit to Baku reinforced what a tremendous restaurant this really is. We started with a splendid Calamari appetizer, which was flavorful, crisp and delicious. The Wagyu Tataki and Lobster rolls that followed were wonderful, especially when paired with a steaming bowl of the Wild Mushroom Kamameshi and a refreshing Asahi Super Dry lager. We finished the meal with a sumptuous slice of chocolate cake with white chocolate mousse -- a fantastic ending to another amazing meal at one of Charlotte's best restaurants.

2oN7dVWqEkZ3ec6dqtfrdg.text: This place is absolutely awesome. I'm generally a tough critic but this place has blown me away. The service has been great and the food has been even better. I would recommend this Asian fusion to anyone!!! This place focuses on experience, which is sooooo appreciated.   Anthony is the best waiter in Charlotte!

DiiIWVQ_ydwr9m9rbMR8mA.text: I can't get behind Baku.  It's not the portion size or the price but rather the quality and the taste quotient.    I'm a serious sushi guy and this places misses the mark.    I found the sashimi was either too cold or certainly not melt-in-the-mouth fresh.  The assortment was so plain I could have found more eclecticism in a grocery store and the slices were strangely extremely thick cuts, not at all expertly done.  Served on a giant block of ice this was boorish sushi 101.    They claimed to have fresh wasabi, but apparently don't know what this means as it was the powdery fake stuff.  I even asked the server and they thought it was fresh.  I didn't bemoan it in person because I didn't want to be *that guy* but the servers should at least be educated on the cuisine.  The Baku salad is the best thing to order here as the greens are fresh and the dressing light and sweet.   The edamame was disappointing and had a freeze-dried texture to it--eew!  As I'm a glutton for punishment I tried the miso-glazed black cod.  Even though I had pointed out to my server that I wanted to do a healthy meal, he didn't mention their miso cod is basically butter cod!!  I almost forgot the kumamoto oysters which were one step away from being off and garishly presented with giant watermelon bubbles which looked like some sort of sick growth.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baku salad - really good!!

EKe3_wCo8yQDP5TEss1Hfw.text: The food was ok, the portions are really small for the price. The steaks are all over cooked and when we were there it was hot as hell in there! We couldn't enjoy our food, would  probably not go back there for what we spent, not worth the money!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon belly nigiri
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States

G2ytQ6clrjEGJ0uzi4C5IQ.text: Placing 1-3 stars 3 being most liked by our group. Ordered the **Ribs, ***Soft shell crab roll, ***uni shooters, **sashimi plate, ***pork belly, *tomahawk steak, *dumplings, and *Brussel sprouts. Uni shooters with quail and truffle were my favorite. The pork belly came in next and was very juicy and tender. Raw scallop was perfect on the sushi plate, just wish there was more. The ribs were a bit too salty and the Brussels sprouts were too oily (even asked for them with out oil after seeing them on someone else's table). The tomahawk steak wasn't a great value and didn't compare to the others I've ordered around. It's our 3rd or 4th time coming here, we will be back but will try other items!

Z7DR5xLeD_aO71jsHsJx7Q.text: Ended up at Baku Thursday night after the wait at Cowfish was more than 30 minutes at 8:00pm. I called Baku and they said they could get us right in. I've been here before twice but both were for restaurant week. I really enjoyed trying their regular menu, and our waiter was really helpful! They had a special that night of Bluefin tuna served 3 ways from fattiest to least fatty. I would come back just to eat platefuls of that and the salmon belly. Holy God it was good. It should melt in your mouth, which it did, quickly. It was gone in a matter of minutes. We also had the rock shrimp tempura and one of the sushi rolls. Both excellent. My only complaint was that the pork belly was overcooked and the fire alarm went off due to poor ventilation, but all in all, excellent experience!! I will be back!

rTgi3L6mAHGwi2Iz960gvQ.text: I love the vibe of this place.  Great quality good, but fairly small portions. They have valet parking if needed.   My favorite dishes are the scallop skewers, calamari app, and the sushi rolls. The pork belly app is also very delicious if seafood is not your style. Not the best to come here starving or your bill will be quite large.   Tip: if you are looking for a quieter dining experience I recommend requesting to seat downstairs, especially on the weekends. If you enjoy a more lively experience sit upstairs where the bar is at. Also a tv or two up there. On the weekends the music is turned up and it is very energetic, but may be too loud for some. They also have a small patio area out front.

B4eVZQpTgHkyhlWYdFZurw.text: One of the best restaurants I had that serves sushi. Unique and quite authentic sushi and sashimi. Well balanced flavor, gently done so you can still taste the fish. Fresh wasabi. Artistic presentation. Aromatic annd flavorful hot good. To top it off, excellent service and knowledgeable server/waitress. It was so good that I came here each night during my 2 day business travel. See the pictures and let your imagination roll. I recommend anyone to try if you have the budget.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. There won&#39;t be any left in a minute.
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States

6VeEjEnquOQU3G2akq-Kuw.text: Intimate setting and a killer cocktail bar. Monday nights they offer 1/2 price bottles of wine. The selections I always gravitate towards are the Baku Yellowtail and Roasted Hamachi. This is a great spot for date night.

eKIhNGLvOKqAi9iXnDgMuA.text: The atmosphere, waiter  and presentation were fantastic. The miso soup was so bland that it was more like dish water with mushrooms.  Had a lobster roll, toro and soft shell crab roll.  All lack any flavor other than the bitter taste of raw asparagus.  Not what it used to be and definitely not worth the $60.00 per person price tag. Too bad as I remember it being really good two years ago.

b00knLaVMR1szSHRY4is_g.text: Fresh and tasty. A different type of sushi than I usually go for but very good rolls and sauces. I generally go with traditional sushi and they don't vary from the menu. Small vat of sake so you will have to order a couple. Pretty pricey for my liking.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States

QkK0ERRWPqDMCTb3AcDuDw.text: Very consistent Great food They always forget the surprise birthday desert This is the 3rd time they've done it l

x--DV8L1AJ0xhsY6H9Z40g.text: Looking for good chinese or sushi in Charlotte?  We found the best spot and we have declared it Our favorite restaurant in North Carolina.   Our server was wonderful, happy and made the best recommendations. Ask for Jolina, bring your appetite and enjoy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blue fin Toro Tartare - awesome to presentation

l_3Pd_AVWnzMHGV2XFffYQ.text: This was the best dinner had in Charlotte during our first long weekend there. Absolutely delicious.  Service so kind and professional, all dishes SO good and presented so well. Location is cool, when you get in you can smell the cedar wood, which I love, makes me think about mountain hotels. We tasted several dishes, from Uni sashimi to miso black cod glazed pork belly... (see pictures!) I look forward to go back. PS. dishes are not too big in general, so I suggest to order a few and taste (tapas style) but no more than 2 poeple for each dish or there will not be enough :)

RWxFeNxF9MsyI7oTsXGZWg.text: I am new to Charlotte, and came into Baku with only these reviews on yelp to guide me.  I am here to tell you that this is one of the best sushi places I have ever been to.  From the moment I walked in and was greeted, to when I sat at the bar and was immedately served by Joey the bartender, I was treated like a VIP.  The Yellowfin Tuna roll was made custom with an added ingredients with no issues.  The Sazerac was made with expertise.  But the pork belly skewers stole the show.  They were legit, and were highly recommended by Joey.  I will definately be back with a date.

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. The star of the show!  Pork belly skewers!
Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yellowfin Tuna Roll!  Yum!!

OZ_d-KVHzmrEv9L_jr9n_w.text: I will never eat here again!! This was the worst racist place ever!!! Went there for my friends birthday just to have drinks. We ordered food and several other people she knew came as well! About 7:30, 4 other people we knew came by then it was a small crowd of her friends. The last 4 people that came were told by the manger that they were "Inconveniencing the waiters" because she should made reservations and paid the $500 fee to reserve for 25. 25 people did not show up! The place was not packed and we were paying customers! The fact that we were African American and none of the "other patrons " were harassed made it even worse! The food was mediocre and the portions were small. The drinks were ok and the waiters were slow. I'm never coming back.

DLTxv30IxV9dVXP2AJUTsw.text: The service was and is more than disrespectful. I have never heard such blatant racist crap in my life. I'm here to have dinner and seen a best friend of mine, whom was having a birthday dinner. To prevent making this story to long, I was told that we were an inconvenience. Of course my friend had many that stopped by to say hi and she didn't pay their "$500 reservation fee" but I  came to eat and wanted a table. The manage decided to give me a 20 minute explanation than to just clean the table and seat my party of 4. The food is awesome, no doubt but for the manager to feel as though a paying customer is an inconvenience because I didn't look like the other party was disgraceful. Let me not forget to mention that we stood their for 15 minutes as the staff walked past us without even acknowledging our existence. The manager did let me know he isn't under a corporation so he can do as he pleased. Wow is all I have... Maybe he forgot about social media and its ability to bring awareness and change.   Never have to worry about me coming again.

UagKflw64CvRaHICa5wSqg.text: Melange of colors, Thing of beauty and tastes good, Just get the sorbet.  Place is overhyped, Pay too much for what you get, Baku, not Haiku?

photos.caption: Photo of Baku - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious desserts, alcohol too!

qj8f2yJ46HIN4H1AAgpT_Q.text: The porkbelly is f*^#ing bonkers!  Everything was done so right and so fresh. Very impressive wine list as well. Definitely a great date night.

dICNaL5gjnW_bwh0ePDHpw.text: I would give ZERO stars if possible. Probably the worst experience of my life. Every single person we encountered were one step below brain dead, our server told us that we couldn't order what we wanted bc "it's not how we do things" drinks were bland and wrong, and we spent $260 for dinner that was aweful! I'm all about Tappas but that was just bad! I would recommend against...a total let down and would suggest going to McDonalds. After all, that's what I wanted after I left!

uTOcmb05TPJBWbtecaav8w.text: So it's been almost a week since I've been to the restaurant and I CANNOT WAIT to go back!!!  It was sooo good! My Friends and I tried the Omaskase Menu! Amazing doesn't even describe how fantastic it was! The flavors of the food are incredible!  So yummy! HUGE Sake List! GREAT atmosphere, loved the decor! Loved the service! Our Server was very friendly. Staff was very attentive. My compliments to the Chefs, you guys are AMAZING!! Impossible to walk away hungry! What a FANTASTIC experience.

VTQWjLNGXDPa6P23BjfYew.text: So in town for my regular visit from out west and this was the BEST MEAL I've had in months!!  I've been to a couple restaurants similar to Baku in Miami and Los Angles but Baku takes the cake for overall best concept!  We started with the chicken wings and they were probably the best I've ever had and I would say, I'm somewhat of a wings expert!  They were grilled crispy to perfection, the lime juice and salt they give you to sprinkle make the dish!  We had the scallops with smoked duck and they were outstanding!  The sleeper was the Baku salad, which I easily could have eaten a couple extra bowls of.....  For an entree I got the lamb chops and my date got the grilled chicken and both were out of this world!  Overall A++++++     I  read some of the other reviews and don't understand how some people say this place is expensive unless they are Burger King customers.....  Our meal including a fabulous Sake bottle was less than $100!!  GREAT VALUE for what you get!

-WS8Gb4Gbdj2Z4mbkg_LLg.text: My husband and I dined here for our Anniversary on October 23rd.  It was our first time there and it will definitely not be our last.  The service and food were phenomenal!  Our waiter, Mark, definitely made us feel comfortable and since we had never dined at Baku before, he went over the history and menu with us.  He was very knowledgeable, hospitable, and helpful with our selections.  We decided to order a variety of things to share.  Each of the plates were spaced out perfectly, so as soon as we were done with one plate, a new plate came just minutes later.  It was absolutely delicious and we will definitely be returning.

T8eJj0c2SfOJGP3bR07oPg.text: The ambiance is amazing.....you don't even realize you are in Charlotte. The food is just ok I left a bit hungry. It is definitely overpriced. "The drunken whale" sake was good. I would definitely go here for a cocktail or 2 but that's about it

40lkObDy260__Zdn8z-ZuA.text: I had two roles there. One was a sort of spicey tuna and the other was a wagyu with pickled something with truffles. They both were amazing. The ambiance was amazing. My next trip I'll be getting the wagyu tomahawk ribeye.

lQk-twEMv_JiQStxVyMS4w.text: Came here the other night for my birthday dinner with 6 girls. Cocktails, atmosphere, food, and dessert were all amazing! I don't remember our servers name but he was outstanding, very patient and entertaining especially with a rowdy group of women. Thank you Baku for making it a great experience.

FbvD8gSrW3g2fgcdCx-Iag.text: Liked the decor and the server was extremely knowledgable . The drinks were on the weak side but I'm sure it was just a measured pour. We enjoyed the food we had the giant Madagascar prawn, the pork belly skewers, 2 different sushi rolls one was a blue fin tuna ,the other was crab and we started with the roasted oysters . The oysters were my favorite item, exceptional flavor and had me looking forward to what was next , all the food was prepared and presented exceptionally well but other than the oysters i wasnts "wowed" by any of the flavors.  We understood the portions were small as the menu is all Tapas style..( don't go looking for a large portion meal)  The mango cake and the chocolate lava cake were our  deserts they were also very good, the mango cake was a little dry. We like to eat at a lot of high end restaurants and expect to pay for it but I thought Baku was a little over priced for what it was.  It is a great place to meet for a cocktail then a couple of apps before dinner elsewhere ... Didn't hate it and had a great evening but not overly impressed.

35x5lr9oe7Sk8gtg191jLw.text: Tried this place out the 2nd week it opened, and I must say, it was a phenomenal experience.  When walking in, you feel like you are in Tokyo/NYC/South Beach/Hollywood all at the same time.  Great ambiance and music.  It was quite busy that night.  I must also add that we had over 10 people in our party, so it was rather challening for our waiter.  I'll have to go try it again, to see if they improved on their service but other than that,  the food was excellent.  The dessert  was incredible!  It was a giant mountain (literally looked like a mountain) of ice cream gelato, cake, fruit and several other things.  Absolutely delicious!  What a great addition to SouthPark and to Charlotte in general!  So glad to see something more unique in this area instead of the usual Steakhouses and franchise crap.

oC9uLlSG6T-FfXuCcYC05w.text: Baku is unlike anything else in Charlotte.  The food is prepared on Robata and Yakitori grills.  The concept is Japanese-inspired shared plates - presented to the table one at a time so that diners can fully enjoy the flavors of each dish.   We loved being able to try many different dishes, each impeccably prepared and presented beautifully.  Every dish we had was delicious but we especially enjoyed the lamb chops and the pork belly.  The restaurant is gorgeous with gleaming stone walls, textured fiber ceilings, sleek bamboo furniture, vivid art pieces, and perfect lighting.  The upstairs lounge is exquisite!

RtHx2MyCnK_vikKF4t3r8w.text: Excellent!  Every dish is like a work of Art. Wonderful atmosphere, excellent food and service!

eDwVKyvWvQymNU7FPAdNLw.text: After my initial review last November, the manager of Baku reached out to me and kindly offered to send me a gift card to try the restaurant again. I have been meaning to go back but since I travel a lot I was finally able to have dinner there last night. A few weeks back my parents went with some of their friends and told me they had a wonderful experience! I was excited to give Baku another shot and they definitely have vastly improved since my last visit. The service and food were both great! I will definitely be coming back. Our server was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered a variety of items but the standouts were the asparagus, the spicy tuna on crispy rice, the lobster & avocado roll, the tiger prawns tempura (not too breaded), and the chirasi. We also loved the chocolate coconut cake - it was delicious! I was also impressed with the drinks - I got the cucumber jalapeno margarita and also tried the strawberry tune. Both were super yummy and innovative. Again, I will say that it is definitely on the pricey side, so be prepared to spend! :)   It definitely goes to show that it is always good to give restaurants a second chance, especially one that is fairly new. I appreciate the manager for reaching out to me and I look forward to my next meal at Baku.

aTU_l5c0au26O_z-tQY6Jg.text: Very cool place. South Park area needs more establishments like Baku. I haven't eaten here yet but have been for drinks with friends. Nice place to lounge around with friends. Lots of unique drinks and service was excellent. Will def go back sometime soon.

SWLPH9fzQWQJKXvTJrv7hQ.text: Stopped in for a round of cocktails and some dessert.  They were pretty busy so service seemed a little confused and slow.  Drinks were fine and the desserts were pretty good.  Our server even gave us an extra dessert because he felt that things were taking a while.  Thought it was a nice gesture.  Overall, 3 stars for our brief visit with them.  Nothing impressed me, but I had no real concerns either.

MDrPOZfwhMAYZFFOL3DTrg.text: If I could give Baku more than a 5, I totally would!  This place is beyond amazing!  Well worth your time & money!

iEvFNsJ0AZTDm5n6O3mI1w.text: My husband and I dined here for the first time on a Thursday night.  First of all, WOW!  This place was so chic.  The ambiance took me straight to Chelsea NYC a la Hiro Ballroom.  Very cool!  The service was impeccable.  We started out with the delicious white truffle artichokes, moving on to the pork belly and kimchi that was spicy and tasted like the ocean...both delicious, as well.  Next came a special of eggplant and mushroom dumplings.  They were...meh...ok, but my husband loved them, as he is a super-fan of ginger, and me, not so much.  The last course was the wagyu beef tartare that was topped with a quail egg and accompanied with cavier.  Holy crap!  I wasn't wild about the idea of eating raw beef, but my husband said there wasn't another option.  I dove in......and finished most of the dish without sharing.    I can't wait to dine here again and try some other items!

2TWzPmuqrKDCcvZ4RR5EpA.text: I had dinner here and it was amazing! I wish I could eat here every day! The inside is decorated very nicely and is very clean. The food has so much flavor, and the service is great! I recommend this restaurant to everyone!

fhoYlcCTwWuWpe8qvK1DKw.text: Freshest fish in Charlotte.  The tuna practically melts in your mouth, and the cod was unbelievable.  Great beer selection, and my colleagues approved of the saki.  Yes, it's pricey but it's also fresh, trendy, inventive, and fun.  Would be a great place to impress a date or host an expensive but swanky party.  Our large party utilized the upstairs private room, and we had a server who knocked our socks off by selecting a tantalizing collection of small plates based on our tastes.  Plenty of free parking available.  I'll be finding an excuse to come back soon.

TSdGZyXWorLM2qFm9762TQ.text: Went with work colleagues and was pleasantly surprised with ambiance matching the food quality. Service was impeccable as were the Lychee Martinis!!  Highly recommend and will definitely be coming back the next time I'm in Charlotte.

8mrkXyg5RQ9qnLg_JkBOOQ.text: The food we had was great, I really enjoyed everything we ordered. But we had a few issues. We were seated by the hostess at what looked like a bar table, people at the bar kept bumping into us.   The service was energetic, but too much. I may not have eaten at a Japanese Robata before but I have eaten at a restaurant before and I understand the concept of small plates and getting lighter dishes first and then moving on to heavier dishes. All of these concepts (and many more) were explained to us in great detail by our waiter, It was just too much.  He even told me I was eating one dish incorrectly.  He also told us in Japan its considered rude to use the wet cloths they bring out before the food for anything other than cleaning your hands.  Apparently, he was concerned we would take sponge baths in the dining room. So that was special.   I really enjoyed the food itself but the waiter was way too much a part of our dinner, the noise was bad, drinks were slow, and we had no room.  I will go back for the food and that is the only reason I gave it 3 stars, but if we have the same waiter I will run for the door.
